Lines.Text: You can't be in here, %PCRace. And I'm afraid I can't let you leave. The Company wouldn't like that at all.
You can't be in here, %PCRace. And I'm afraid I can't let you leave. The Company wouldn't like that at all.
What are you doing! We'll let your actions go for now, but once you're released, stuff like that will get you arrested again.
I don't want to talk about it.
I've heard you've got a price on your head, %PCRank. For a small fee, I can take care of that.
I've heard you've got a price on your head, %PCRank. For a small fee, I can take care of that.
I've heard you've got a price on your head, %PCRank. For a small fee, I can take care of that.
I've heard you've got a price on your head, %PCRank. For a small fee, I can take care of that.
You've earned a death warrant for your crimes, outlaw. May the gods have mercy upon your soul.
I accept this gold in payment of the fines and compensation ordered by the court. And now you are free to go.
I accept this gold in payment of the fines and compensation ordered by the court. And now you are free to go.
Then you must serve a sentence of hard labor. Serve your time peaceably, and pay your debt to society.
Then pay with your blood, outlaw!
Your papers seem to be in order, but you still have outstanding issues. Pay your remaining fines, or come with me.
You have no legitimate writs. Pay your fine, or come with me.
Your papers seem to be in order, but you still have outstanding issues. Come with me.
The writs are not legitimate. You must come with me.
All of your papers seem to be in order. You are free to go.
Where did you get that! The armor you wear is sacred to our Order. You shall be punished with blood!
You've committed a crime, vampire. Were you not an abomination, I might let you live. Prepare to die!

You violated the law, %PCName. Pay the court %PCCrimeLevel gold and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.
Scripts: Choice, "Pay Gold.", 1, "Go to Jail.", 2, "Resist Arrest.", 3, "Present Writs", 4

Lines.Text: You violated the law, %PCName. Pay the court %PCCrimeLevel gold and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.
You violated the law, %PCName. Since you don't have the %PCCrimeLevel gold to pay the court, you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of punitive labor. Come with me.
You violated the law, %PCName. Since you don't have the %PCCrimeLevel gold to pay the court, you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of punitive labor. Come with me.

You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. Pay %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to the court and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.
Scripts: Choice, "Pay Gold.", 5, "Go to Jail.", 2, "Resist Arrest.", 3, "Present Writs", 4

Lines.Text: You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. Pay %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to the court and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.

You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. But you don't have the %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to pay the court, so you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence at hard labor. Come with me.

You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. But you don't have the %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to pay the court, so you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence at hard labor. Come with me.
Squeak!
Squeak!
Squeak?
Squeak!
Squeak!
Squeak?

Halt!  The King suspected you might try something treacherous with his champion. He cannot allow this to continue. By order of His Royal Highness King Hlaalu Helseth, Duke of Mournhold, you are ordered to accompany me to the prison until His Highness deems you fit to engage in the agreed-upon contest.

You violated the law, %PCName. Pay the court %PCCrimeLevel gold and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.
Scripts: Choice, "Pay Gold.", 1, "Go to Jail.", 2, "Resist Arrest.", 3, "Present Writs", 4

Lines.Text: You violated the law, %PCName. Since you don't have the %PCCrimeLevel gold to pay the court, you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of punitive labor. Come with me.

You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. Pay %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to the court and surrender your stolen goods, or surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence of hard labor. Deliver the gold immediately, or come with me.
Scripts: Choice, "Pay Gold.", 5, "Go to Jail.", 2, "Resist Arrest.", 3, "Present Writs", 4

Lines.Text: You violated the law, %PCName. Since you turned yourself in voluntarily, I'll take that into consideration. But you don't have the %CrimeGoldTurnIn gold to pay the court, so you must surrender your stolen goods and serve your sentence at hard labor. Come with me.

You say you've been attacked by assassins? From your description, and the look of that dart you found, it sounds like the work of the Dark Brotherhood. I'm not sure who you angered, but stay away from me. I suppose this should be officially reported, though. Speak to Apelles Matius in Ebonheart about this matter.

You say you've been attacked by assassins? From your description, it sounds like the work of the Dark Brotherhood. I'm not sure who you angered, but stay away from me. I suppose this should be officially reported, though. Speak to Apelles Matius in Ebonheart about this matter.
I did not wish this upon you, Blodskaal, but you leave me little choice.
I accept the gold for the Skaal people. It will be added to the coffers of the village. Take care, Blodskaal. Do not let this become a habit.
You have violated laws of the Skaal. Though you have been named Blodskaal, you are also known to be under the shadow of the beast. You must pay with your life.
You have violated laws of the Skaal. Though you have been named Blodskaal, you have no means to pay reparations to the Skaal. You must pay with your life.
You have violated laws of the Skaal. You have been named Blodskaal, so you are offered a choice: pay %PCCrimeLevel in reparations to the Skaal or pay with your life.
You have violated laws of the Skaal. As you are not of our people, you will pay for your crimes.
Stop! You are a known criminal as well as a werewolf. Though you say you have cured yourself of this foul curse, you will spend some time in jail until that is certain.
Stop! You are a known criminal as well as a werewolf. Though you say you have cured yourself of this foul curse, you will spend some time in jail until that is certain.
You! Criminal and obscene beast! There is no escape for you, foul creature!
You! Criminal and obscene beast! There is no escape for you, foul creature!
[You have failed your Oath of Silence]
Who's there?
All is silence. The road is straight, without turning, in darkness. Now let there be an end to all things.
Well. Someone finally found me. Your bad luck, really.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
Have you not given me a silver longsword? Just read the shrine and leave. I tire of your mortal presence.
Are you here on the pilgrimage? I take it that silver longsword is for me.
Are you here on the pilgrimage? Read the shrine.
Are you here on the pilgrimage? Do you have a silver longsword for me?
Thank you for your help, %PCName. It looked to me like the place was safe.

I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.
You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.
Here's a little advice. No charge.
Do you want a little advice? Of course you do.
So you're Telvanni. Then you'll understand if I offer you a little advice.
A little advice, outlander. Go away while you can.
Let me offer you a little advice, stranger.
You're House Telvanni? No kidding? Well, in that case, maybe I had better give you a little advice.
You want a little advice, outlander?
Well, well, well. An outlander. And a Telvanni. Will wonders never cease? Then it is in the spirit of a friendly warning that I offer you a little advice.
You have Cloudcleaver, my friend. I would like it back.

Well, this is close enough. Thanks for your help. I suppose it's only fair that I give you your reward. Here, take them. Though it pains me to give them, you are now the owner of the Boots of Blinding Speed.
I have a little advice to share with you, outlander.
You must be the one Relam Arinith sent.
Hey! You shouldn't be back there. That's my private room.
Really, I can't tell you how good it is to be visible again! Thank you so much.

Thank you, thank you! It's so good to be able to be seen again. I just wish I had something to offer you, but I have nothing of value and no gold to speak of. It's not easy to find a job when you're invisible. Thank you again!

Thank you, thank you! It's so good to be able to be seen again. I just wish I had something to offer you, but I have nothing of value and no gold to speak of. It's not easy to find a job when you're invisible. Thank you again!
You're wearing me skirt! How dare you wear my skirt!
Oh, are those my new clothes? I've waited ever so patiently for them.
I heard you killed my patron, Ondres Nerano. I have nothing to say to the likes of you.
You here about your tower? Tell Llunela Hleran things are fine here. The work will be done soon.
This is your tower, right? What do you want, %PCName?
This isn't your tower and this isn't any of your business.
You here about the stronghold? Tell Galsa Gindu things are fine here. The work will be done soon.
You the chief around here, right? What you want?
This not your business here. You leave now.
You here about the stronghold? Tell Dondos the work is on schedule. And he better pay me that bonus he promised.
This your place? What do you want, %PCName?
You don't belong here, just move along.
Welcome to my house, %PCRace. Make yourself at home.
What %Name do for you?
Runa's a real gem, isn't she?
Great place, huh?
Just between you and me, I always rest here between pilgrimages.
If you want a job here, you'll have to talk to Helviane. Excuse me.
Are you okay? You don't look well...
Well, hello there. It's always nice to see another %PCRace.
An Argonian! How exciting. I've never had an Argonian... customer.
Oh no, not another Khajiit. I'm still smarting from the last one.
Hello there, %PCRace. Looking for a good time?
You'd try to steal my weapons, n'wah? Nobody cheats Lucan! Die!
Ahhhh...you've removed this enchantment with your spell to cure disease!
Excuse me, can you help me? No, I'm over here. My name is Cassius Olcinius. Sorry...you see, I've been made invisible by a wizard!
Take this, friend. I think everyone should read this leaflet. It has important information on it.
You are pathetic! Where is your power, vampire? You have nothing I desire. Leave me now. All I have heard about your kind is a lie.
I smell Berne blood on you! Die!

Ahhhhh! The power once again flows through my limbs! I am whole again! Now, I shall once again feed on the mortals above, pay them for my years of imprisonment! You are useless to me now, young fool. You shall be the first to die at my hands. Consider it an honor. Mastrius walks again!
Enough %PCName. You beat me fairly. I'll tell Dram what happened.
You want another shot at me, %PCName?
I'm here, %PCName. Come for me.
You want a duel? You got a duel.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
Come to collect more debts for cowardly smiths, %PCName?
I conceded. I gave you the debt money. Take it and leave.
I... I concede. Take these 2000 drakes and give them to Tuveso Beloth.
I'm not paying those armor repair debts.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
Oh, don't mind me. Whatever affair of honor you have with Giras Indaram, it's none of my business.
Darius says you can be here, so it's okay with me.
You fight pretty well for a Redoran. I take back what I said about Bolvyn Venim.
What are you doing? Get out of there! Who sent you here? Get away!!!
Hello...hello? Who are you? What are you doing here? Please, you must leave.
Move along, %PCRace... Wait! You're the one protecting Saprius Entius!

Well, %PCName, we're getting pretty close to the city, and they don't let big ol' guar like Rollie here inside the walls. Seems a shame, since he's such a personable sort. Isn't that right, Rollie? Anyway, from here, you and I can travel on to Agrippina's alone.
You've wasted enough of my time.
You've wasted enough of my time. I'll find some other commoner to help.
Move along, %PCRace... Wait! You're the one protecting Saprius Entius!
I'm just glad it's over.
Is the Scamp really gone? Thank you, whoever you are. This is all my fault.
Please, whoever you are, kill the Scamp before it causes any more trouble.
Thanks for getting me here safely. I'll stay here until Frald the White can get me back to Cyrodiil.
Shall we travel together back to Ebonheart?
Thank you. We should travel together back to Frald the White in Ebonheart.
Help me fight them!
Who are you? Are you in the Imperial Legion? The Ordinators have been looking for me. I've done a terrible thing. Can you... Look out! Behind you!
You do not have an appointment to see Varona Nelas.
To the death!
Oh, dear. Another poor, unfortunate traveler, come to a bad end.
I don't care who you are. I just want you out of here. Or dead.
I hate fighting amateurs. It takes the joy out of winning.
You made a big mistake, pilgrim.
Die, thief!

I am concerned. Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Have you done something wrong? Have you forgotten your destiny? I have heard that the leader of the Temple, a man named Tholer Saryoni, is desperate, and asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Is there something wrong? Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple has asked that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

We are concerned. Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Have you done something wrong? Have you forgotten your destiny? We hear that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is desperate, and that he asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

I am surprised. And a bit disappointed. I thought you were the Nerevarine? Why haven't you fulfilled the prophecies? Is something wrong? Did you do something you shouldn't? I've heard rumors that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is desperate, and that he asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. If there is some problem, maybe you should go talk to Saryoni.

Well. If you are the Nerevarine, why haven't you fulfilled the prophecies? Surely you haven't forgotten. You haven't done something foolish, have you? You mustn't be shy, dumpling. I've heard that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is VERY upset, and that he is hoping that you will come speak with him at the High Fane here in Vivec City. Maybe that would be a good idea. Don't you think?

I don't mean to pry into your affairs. But, if you are the Nerevarine, as they say, why haven't you fulfilled the Nerevarine prophecies? The people are badly frightened by these Sixth House disturbances. You haven't gotten yourself into any sort of trouble, have you? A discreet contact tells me that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is becoming desperate, and that he is hoping that you will come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Maybe that would be best.
I see you have equipped Wraithguard. I wish you luck with it.

Remember. When you first equip Wraithguard, you must endure a terrible shock. Even if you are in perfect health, and have fortified your health as much as possible, you are likely to die from the shock. Don't even think about it until you are much healthier.

Remember. When you first equip Wraithguard, you must endure a terrible shock. If you are not in perfect health, and have not fortified your health as much as possible, you'll be dead before you hit the ground.
I have learned all I can from Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals. Now, if you're still willing, I'll try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.
Patience. When I have had sufficient time to review Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals, I will try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.
If you have really brought me Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals, I can at least try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.
I have nothing. Go away. Leave me in peace... but... wait. What is that you have there? Is that what I think it is? That unique dwemer artifact you have?
I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. Word on the street is that you've become Mercius' lapdog, and he's sent you to kill me. I'm afraid I can't let that happen. You were always a disappointment.
I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. I also heard you've been sent to kill me. I'm the only one who'll be taking over as Guildmaster. I won't let you take my rank in the Guild!
I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. I'm the only one who'll be taking over as Guildmaster. I won't let you take my rank in the Guild!
I thought I told you to leave.
You're not supposed to be here. I'm gonna count to ten. And if you're still here when I'm done, you're gonna be in big trouble.
You're not going anywhere with that Axe!
You have heard my story. Do what you will.
Do not fear me, %PCRace. Listen, and I will tell you how I was murdered by Lugrub gro-Ogdum.
What are you doing here? You must be a thief!
Thank you for getting me to the Ald Velothi Outpost.
Who are you? Where are your papers?
First, let me take your identification papers. Thank you. Word of your arrival only reached me yesterday. I am %name. But my background is not important. I'm here to welcome you to Morrowind.
I am %name. My background is not important. From time to time it is my duty to welcome certain visitors to Morrowind.
Thank you. Don't think I ever get out of that place.
Greetings! M'Aiq knows many things. What is your interest? You seek knowledge. M'Aiq has much. Some of it verified by actual facts!
Go away! Leave me alone! I'll never speak to you again!
Never! Yield? To you? I'd rather die than yield to you, f'lah!
The witch is dead! Now, if you'll just give me Widowmaker, stranger, I'd appreciate it. I might be able to teach you a bit about using an axe as well, if you're interested.

Yes. This is the place I need to be. They can help me here. Take this as payment, and I'll make sure to tell my friends in the Legion about your help. Thank you, friend--you have been a big help. You know, for a slaughterfish.
Well, we've arrived...surprisingly enough. Here's your tip. Now leave me.
I should have expected as much from the likes of you. I'll be on my way now.
Do you have any idea where you're going at all? Have you ever even been to Ghostgate? I'm in a hurry, and you're as slow as a three-legged guar.
Do you even know where you're leading me? I'm not a woman accustomed to waiting. You've got one more day to get me there.
What's taking so long? I need to be there in the next day and a half. Hurry up, would you?
No, she can't be dead! Goodbye, %PCName.

Thank the gods! We've found her! I never thought I'd see her again. You finding me has truly been a blessing. Thank you so much for your help, %PCName. I wish I had more to offer you, but please take this book. It has meant so much to the two of us. I can only hope you find as much enjoyment in it as we have. Take care!
Thank you for your help, %PCName. Here is the payment I promised you. May all of your travels be safe.

Here our journey ends, %PCRace. For bringing me to this place, I thank you. It has been a thorn in the side of the Camonna Tong for too long, too long. It seems the Redguard is dead already. That is acceptable. I have no further business with you.

Here our journey ends, %PCRace. For bringing me to this place, I thank you. It has been a thorn in the side of the Camonna Tong for too long, too long. Be on your way, outlander, or with this Redguard, you will die. That is the choice I give you.
[Rollie thinks twice and says nothing.]
[Rollie, being a deep thinker, has no words for now.]
[Rollie gazes at you with soulful eyes, but says nothing.]
[Rollie seems about to speak, but then thinks better of it.]
[Rollie says nothing to you at this time.]
Don't want to work. Just want to bang on my drum. What's a scamp gotta do?
C'mon...help a scamp out. You gotta need something. I've got booze....
Help me out. I need the money.
Hello Caldera!!! I'm here all week!
I'm creeping!
My sorrow is too great to speak anymore.
Ah, well. I suppose I knew that already. Best of luck to you.
Excellent! Let's go!
You've decided to help...wait. Thoronor is dead? I have no reason to go on.
Have you decided you'd like to help me after all?
Scripts: Choice "I suppose. Follow me." 1 "No. Never mind." 2

Lines.Text: This is...wait...Thoronor is dead? Oh, that's terrible. I have no reason to continue on.
Why, thank you! I'm sure this will do the trick. Let's get going; I'll follow you back. Although, this would be an excellent chance to study them in great detail without being noticed....
Yes, we are going together to Ald Daedroth, where we will see if you have made it safe for the Ahemmusa. I will accompany you until we stand before the great statue, where we will speak further.
You've spoken to the archcanon? Good. Then, is there anything else you want?

I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. The Nerevarine prophecies are evil superstitions, based on lies and delusions. And even if the prophecies were genuine, since you have killed one of the leaders of the Ashlander tribes, now there is no possibility that you could be accepted by the Ashlander tribes as the Nerevarine of prophecy. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.
Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.
We're here to discuss the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine, %PCName.
Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.
Have you found the Ebony Mail?
Have you completed the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners?
I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.
I'm sorry, but we have nothing to discuss.
Faith conquers all, Nerevarine. Bless your breath and blood.
Are you here to request an audience, %PCRank?
Please leave. These are my private quarters.
Faith, law, and justice. Walk on.
We know your plan, Outlander....
Faith, law, and justice. Walk on.
So. It's you again. What brings you to visit Yagrum Bagarn, Master Crafter, and Last Living Dwarf?
So. It's you again. What brings you to visit Yagrum Bagarn, Master Crafter, and Last Living Dwarf?

You're here for the Dwemer boots. Tell my gracious Keeper that I have done what I could. Only a Dwemer magecrafter could have done so much. But only idiots could have created these boots. It shames my race that we must be judged by the works of such lack-wit blunderers.
I have Lord Fyr's Dwemer boots. That's what you're here for, aren't you?
Do not harm me, or you will be very sorry. I warn you. Leave me alone, and I will leave you alone.
I have nothing. Go away. Leave me in peace.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.
You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

Hello, %PCName. How are you doing? Bit of bad news, I'm afraid. The potion doesn't seem to work on others. Tried it on two hopeless cases. Killed them outright. Deader than a garlic snail. But is there anything I can help you with?

A gift? For me? How thoughtful. And shrewd. I suppose you know I am a collector. And that such a gift is bound to please me. I congratulate you on your diplomatic skills. So, why have you tried to butter me up? Come to consult the great Divayth Fyr? You have the divine disease? Want to plunder the dungeon? Or leer at my daughters?
A pity. I can see why you'd want to keep such a lovely relic of Dwemer culture. But now, if you'll excuse me, I have no time for idle chatter.
Say. That's an interesting Dwemer piece you have there. What can you tell me about it?
Scripts: Choice "Offer the Dwemer artifact as a gift." 1 "Politely show him the piece, then put it away." 2

Lines.Text: Yes, yes, %PCName. You're completely cured. Did you forget something?
Well? Are you ready to take the potion?
Well? Did you get my boots? No boots, no potion....
Well! What a pleasure! A visitor! An entertaining diversion! Come to consult the great Divayth Fyr? You have the divine disease? Want to plunder the dungeon? Or leer at my daughters?
You again? A surprise, and a pleasure! Didn't we have a satisfactory chat? Something else you want to know about the divine disease? Eager to plunder the dungeon? Questions about my daughters?
Not interesting. Sorry. Not your fault, perhaps, but you are not interesting, and I can't waste energy talking to boring people.
Listen. You are not interesting. No offense, but I don't want to talk to you.

Lines.NPCCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Hall of Fyr
Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.NPCCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Onyx Hall
Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.NPCCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Hall of Fyr
Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of my benefactors. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.NPCCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Onyx Hall
Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.NPCCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Hall of Fyr
Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of my benefactors. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

Lines.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.
You've killed one of my benefactors. And now it is your turn to die.

I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. And you have killed one of the inmates that I am sworn to protect. Prepare to receive your just punishment.

I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.

I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.
You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.
You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.
I suppose you want to speak to Divayth Fyr? Have you got corprus disease? Or were you planning to plunder the dungeon?
Go talk to Divayth Fyr. He's the one you're looking for.
Have you come to plunder the dungeon? Or have you got corprus disease? Or did you come to see Divayth Fyr? I'm Beyte Fyr. I'm the wife of Divayth Fyr. One of them. Sort of.
Are you here to plunder the dungeon? Have you got corprus disease? Did you want to talk to Divayth Fyr?
My name is Delte Fyr. Did you want to see Divayth Fyr? Have you got corprus disease? Or are you another questing hero looking to plunder the dungeon?
If you have corprus disease, you need the Corprusarium. Or do you want Divayth Fyr?
You're new here, aren't you? My name is Uupse. Uupse Fyr. I take care of the corprus victims in the Corprusarium.
I see you found a guarskin drum.
Make yourself at home. I have some things to do.
Thanks for getting me back to Maar Gan, %PCName.
Do you want me to wait here?
Shall we travel together back to Maar Gan?
We're on the way to Pelagiad, %PCName. Tell me if you no longer want to travel together.
We're on the way back to Novor Drethan, %PCName. Tell me if you no longer want to travel together.
The blight is gone, and we have survived. Now we must dedicate ourselves to rebuilding the Temple. And you must dedicate yourself to your responsibilities as Protector of Morrowind.
I expected you. We have business, you and I.
Was there something else?
You have come uninvited. I have nothing to say to you.

It began here. It will end here. Have you any parting words? Or would you prefer to skip the speeches, and get to our business. You are the challenger here, after all. So to you goes the courtesy of the first blow.
Have you something more to say?

It began here. It will end here. Have you any parting words? Or would you prefer to skip the speeches, and get to our business. You are the challenger here, after all. So to you goes the courtesy of the first blow.
Have you something more to say?
Strange. This outcome I did not foresee. That you would come unprepared.
Until I see you better prepared, we have nothing to discuss.
Quickly! Did you want to meet the archcanon?

[whispers] No. Didn't you read the note? Until you are named Hortator by the three Houses and Nerevarine by the four tribes, there is no point in discussing your claims. Now... go away before someone sees us talking.
Thank you for your help, %PCName. As promised, here is your payment.
Clearly, you don't know where you're going. You've wasted two days of my time, and now I won't make it to Koal Cave on time. Thanks for nothing.
Are you sure you know the way to Koal Cave? I need to be there in the next half day.
It's already been a day that I've been traveling with you, and I'll need to be there within another day. Can we get moving?
As I've told you, I need to be in Koal Cave in the next day and a half. Let's be on our way.
Yes, yes, sera. Yes, we are here safely. And this fine man, he is to be my bridegroom?
Yes, %PCName. Are you ready now to travel together to Zainab camp?
Yes, %PCName. We travel together to Zainab camp. When we arrive there, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.
You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.
You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.
You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.
Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?
Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?
Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?
Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?
Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?
Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?
What do you want?
What do you want?
What do you want?
Meow.
Wanna drink, buddy? Got anything you want, so long as it's sujamma.
Back again? I dunno, pal. You look like you've had plenty. Or maybe you ALWAYS look that way.
Back already? Well, go ahead, drink up. It's free.
Well, well, well. What do we have here? Do you have your invitation? Are you a Player of the Game? Or one of the Game Pieces? Or a humble Spectator?
Go ahead. It's your move.
Everything is perfectly all right. We heard the word. Hlireni Indavel says lay off you and the savages. We won't touch them, or you, as long as you leave us alone. [Whispers: Spoil-sport.]
Everything is perfectly all right. We heard the word. Hlireni Indavel says lay off you and the savages. We won't touch them, or you, as long as you leave us alone. [Whispers: Spoil-sport.]
Don't worry. Hlireni Indavel says leave you and the poor starving Ashlanders alone.
Don't worry. Hlireni Indavel says leave you and the poor starving Ashlanders alone.
I don't know you, do I? Are you here for the dance? Or are you here with the gold-hats?
I don't know you, do I? Are you here for the dance? Or are you here with the gold-hats?
Come on. Get into the spirit of things. You want to tumble?
Come on. Get into the spirit of things. You want to tumble?

%PCRank %PCName. You are not allowed in here. You must leave. Immediately. And without hesitation. If you do not leave immediately, peacefully, we will use force, and I will not be responsible for your safety.

%PCRank %PCName. With all due respect, you have no authority here. I don't know what you think you're doing, but you won't do it on my watch. If you do not leave immediately, I cannot be responsible for your safety.
You're making a big mistake, %PCName.
I don't care who you are, or why you're here. No one comes in here without proper authorization. Now, get out, while you can.
Someone is going to going to regret this mistake. Dearly.

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: I don't care WHO you are, %PCRank. You don't belong in here. So get out. Right now. Don't make me use force.

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: You just won't listen.

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: %PCRank %PCName. I don't like this at all. This is completely against procedures. But I don't seem to have much choice. The key is in the Inquisitor's office. But the guards are not going to like it. Not one bit.

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: The key? I told you. It's in the Inquisitor's office.

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: Guards! Intruder!
%PCRank %PCName. This is against procedures. And you know it. Get out of here. Immediately.
I told you. Get out of here. Now!
%PCRank %PCName. This is against procedures. And you know it. Go ahead. The key is in the desk. But I have to report this. Immediately.
The key is in the desk. Go ahead. I'm not going to stop you.
Guards! Intruder!

Lines.NPCCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
Lines.Text: Poor dumb bastard. Now I have to break another mother's heart.
%PCRank %PCName. You know this is against procedures. I can't let you just walk in here. Please. You have to leave.
Didn't you hear me? I said, you have to leave. You're not supposed to be in here. Get out, immediately, or I'll have to use force.

%PCRank %PCName. You know this is against procedures. I do this under protest. The key is in the desk. I don't know how the others are going to take it. But I don't mind telling you -- I don't like it one bit.
I SAID... the key is in the desk. Get on with it.
The key? In the desk.
Guards! Intruder!

Lines.NPCCell: Vivec, Hall of Justice Secret Library
Lines.Text: You shouldn't be in here. You'd better leave.
You're not supposed to be in here. Get out. Now.
Welcome, Incarnate. I am Conoon Chodala. I was not the one. But I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall tell you my story.
I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall tell you my story.

Welcome, Incarnate, Moon-and-Star Reborn, Hortator, Nerevarine, Mourner of the Tribe Unmourned, Redeemer of the False Gods. I am Peakstar. I was not the one. But I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall answer, if wisdom guides me.
I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall answer.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
I am a Sleeper, one among thousands. I bring you a message. Dagoth Ur calls you, %PCName, and you cannot deny your Lord. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.

Beneath Red Mountain, Lord Dagoth sleeps. But when he wakes, we all shall rise, and the dust will blow away. Serve your Lord, Dagoth Ur. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.
