He said you would come to us. And he was right. Have you come to submit? Or come to die?
So. Have you decided? Have you come to submit? Or come to die?
%PCName. Star-blessed hero? Or the Daedra's Pawn? Only one way to find out. If you have the courage.
I'm a sportsman. I'll give you a fighting chance. Go ahead. Make the first move.
Look! It's Azura's Fool! Look at you. Not a real thing at all. Just a pathetic puppet of prophecy. And you think you can trust the Daedra Lords?

Come on! You're the prophesied Incarnate! Azura has promised you fame and glory! Surely you can't be afraid of me, can you? Don't be shy. With a Daedra Lord for ally and patron, how could you lose? Oh, PLEASE don't hurt me, star-blessed hero!
What are you doing? You have no idea. Poor animal. You struggle and fight, and understand nothing.
A bug. A weed. A piece of dust. Busy, busy, busy.
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
WHERE ARE YOU, LORD? We cannot hear you.... SPEAK to us! PLEASE!
What are you? Where is this place? I'm so tired, LET ME SLEEP!
The chairs. The tables. All confused. We hear the words, and must speak them. We take them, and arrange them, but still, they will not be quiet.
Everything is wrong. This is not straight. This is too high. This is in my way. We must put them right.
We do not fear death. Life is a dream. Blood is a dream. We sleep in one soul, the soul of Lord Dagoth.
What are you? Nothing. Why are you here? You do not know.
You have betrayed Lord Dagoth. Taste his vengeance.
You will die, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.
We have you in our eye, %PCName. We see you, waking and sleeping.
We see you, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.
What are you doing? You have no idea. Poor animal. You struggle and fight, and understand nothing.
A bug. A weed. A piece of dust. Busy, busy, busy.
At the lonely hour of midnight, I fly, when stars are weeping. Beneath the echo of souls, my spirit sleeping.
Fire, poisons, claws, pincers, wheels... what slave knows what the lover feels?
What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.
For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.
I have you in my eye. I see you, %PCName, and my Lord sees you.
Your are welcome, %PCName. You are in no danger.
The chairs. The tables. All confused. We hear the words, and must speak them. We take them, and arrange them, but still, they will not be quiet.
Everything is wrong. This is not straight. This is too high. This is in my way. We must put them right.
We do not fear death. Life is a dream. Blood is a dream. We sleep in one soul, the soul of Lord Dagoth.
What are you? Nothing. Why are you here? You do not know.
WHERE ARE YOU, LORD? We cannot hear you.... SPEAK to us! PLEASE!
What are you? Where is this place? I'm so tired, LET ME SLEEP!
You've done well to come this far. I don't think we have anything to talk about, do we? Then let's get on with it.
I'm ready whenever you are.
I'm not here to talk. I'm here to fight.
Oh, just shut up, will you?
No. I'm sorry. No flowery speeches. No subtle tricks. No formal boasts or challenges. Fight. Or leave. But don't expect me to pass the time of day with you.
Goodbye.
I greet you, %PCName. Or Nerevar. Or whoever you are. I'm Dagoth Endus, brother of Dagoth Ur, and lord of Citadel Endusal. Would you like a little ancient Dagoth brandy?
Yes, %PCName. Before we fight, can I offer you a little ancient Dagoth brandy?
What? You want to talk? You want to surrender? To boast? To talk me to death?
Go ahead, windbag. Talk, talk, talk. Anything to delay your coming defeat.
Well, %PCName. Have you come to serve? Or to challenge my station? Or to try to win Keening?
Consider, %PCName. Where do your best interests lie? It is not too late to serve....

The Sixth House greets you, Lord Nerevar. Or %PCName, as you call yourself. I am known as Dagoth Gares, priest of Ilunibi Shrine, and minister to Sixth House servants. My Lord, Dagoth Ur, has informed me of your coming. I wish that this time you had come to honor your Lord's friendship, not to betray it.
Yes, Lord Nerevar? What would you ask of me? Would you hear of my Lord, Dagoth Ur? Or of the Sixth House, or of Sixth House servants?

The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.
You have betrayed Lord Dagoth. Taste his vengeance.
You will die, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.
We see you, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.
We have you in our discerning eye, %PCName. We see you, waking and sleeping.
Beneath Red Mountain, Lord Dagoth has awakened. Now Sleepers and Dreamers all are risen, and the dust is blown away. Come to your Lord, Dagoth Ur. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.
Can we get moving, %PCRace? We've a long way to go.

Okay, %PCName, we've made it. I thank you for your help, and Rollie would if he were allowed in the city. I really must speak with someone about that. Think how much he'd enjoy visiting this place. He'd be talking about it for days. Oh, I suppose you're wondering about compensation for your trouble?
You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.
You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.
You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.
Are you here to join the Imperial Legion?
You're out of uniform. Talk to me when you're serious.
I'm glad to see you again, %PCName.
What? Another man? Guards! Oh, it's you again. You have my vote, %PCName. But I think it's time for you to leave.
You again! What do you want this time?
Yes, %PCName?
Have you taken care of House Telvanni yet, %PCRank %PCName?
So, have you gathered the votes of the other councilors?
Oh. Goody, goody. Are you going to show me that thing you did again?
What can %Name do for you?
What can I do for you, master?

What are you doing here? Those bastards kicked me out of the Legion...and for what? Idiots, all of them. I'm surprised the fools even knew it was gone. But it's mine now. And that's how it will stay. And you will tell no one!
Ah, %PCName. Friend of the Temple, and healer of Mournhold. What can I do for you?
Have you any news about the Crimson Plague, %PCName?
Have you any news, %PCName?
Were you able to help Shunari, %PCName?
Fedris Hler must be told of this attack. Get yourself to the Temple and let him know! Go!
This attack must be reported. We will stay here and guard against further attacks. Go tell Tienius Delitian! Run!
Someone must make sure Fedris Hler is informed of these attacks. I cannot leave my post. Tell him!
Someone must make sure Tienius Delitian is informed of these attacks. I cannot leave my post. Tell him!
Mournhold is under attack! Take arms and armor to Plaza Brindisi Dorom -- they need your help!
They're attacking the city! Don't just stand there! DO something!
You are a wanted criminal, and will be punished. You stand here only by the Lady's mercy. Take great care, lest you meet the Hands.
You wear the sacred garb of the Ordinator, but you are not of the Order. I stay my hand solely at the Lady's discretion. Speak with me no more.
We await the Goddess' command. Her word is our law. There is no time to speak with the likes of you.
I suggest you go help Shunari, and quickly at that. She may have information we need to figure out what's going on.
I heard noises from downstairs. What's happened?
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Fons Beren!
%PCName, there is much to discuss. It seems the situation is more serious than I'd expected. I've examined the rat you see here, and I've detemined what infected it - the Crimson Plague.
I've told you I want no further contact with you. I'll handle this on my own. Please leave.
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Sunel Hlas!
Have you delivered that Cure Disease Potion, %PCName? I'd be grateful if you've done me that favor.
I've told you I want no further contact with you. I'll handle the situation on my own. Please leave.
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!
This is a serious turn of events, %PCName. Perhaps I've underestimated what's going on here. May I ask another favor of you?
You're armed? Good! Help the guard! Destroy these devices!
Welcome back, %PCName. Have you been able to deliver that Cure Disease Potion?
Mournhold is under attack! Monsters have broken into Plaza Brindisi Dorom! You're armed! Go help them!
Have you heard? The city is under attack! Enchanted machines have burst into Plaza Brindisi Dorom and are killing everyone! They need your help! GO!
Okay, okay. Just give us some time to work something out. Now get out of here, or else Dovor might get suspicious.
Mournhold is under attack! They've mobilized the guard and militia! All able-bodied citizens should report to Plaza Brindisi Dorom, armed and armored, immediately!
Plaza Brindisi Dorom is under attack! They've called out the Guard, but they're outnumbered! Go! They need your help!
We're under attack! Go to Plaza Brindisi Dorom -- hurry!
What's this about the Dark Brotherhood? You say you've been attacked by them? The fact that you're standing here seems to suggest otherwise.
My greetings and blessings upon you. I am Eno Romari. How may I help you in your journey through this life?
You again? Already made you a good blade. Stop bugging me.
Yeah, you're the one who wanted me to forge the blade. I suppose you figure I'm finished, huh?
Yeah, you're the one who wants me to forge the blade for you. And you apparently want to bother me. What?
What do you want? I'm here to make weapons, not to chat.

You have no place here, child of living flesh. The Mazed Band must not be allowed to leave this tomb. The Band should never have existed at all. That was my folly, and this is my curse. For all eternity, I am damned to walk in this half life, to keep my creation from destroying the hearts and minds of mortals. Those who would challenge my fate will pay with their lives.
Hold! I am beaten. You are the greater warrior, %PCName. You should speak now with my liege.
[Karrod says nothing.]
No...tell my liege...I have...failed h....

Look, I don't know what's going on in this place. Monsters bursting up from the ground, guards running around everywhere...this is lunacy. You'll notice I'm not blaming this on any witch. And it's still too hot around here.

What're you looking at? No, I'm not paralyzed. And I've never even met a witch, much less been asked to escort one anywhere. Why am I naked? Because it's too damned hot here! You people think that every time you see a naked Nord barbarian, he's been tricked by some witch. So narrow minded. Now leave me alone.
I told you I don't need any help. I'm just trying to cool off a bit. I've never even seen a witch! You people and your stereotypes....
I understand you've been to the Clockwork City, and you alone returned. You've consorted with gods, what can this Queen do for you?
It seems you are destined for great things in Morrowind, my friend. I'm glad there will be another for people to talk about.
My protector! It seems you were able to take care of that ridiculous plot.
Hello again, friend %PCName. There is so much you seem to be involved with. How can I help you?
How goes your quest to forge the Blade of Nerevar?
Good to see you, %PCName. What can one who has defeated the mighty Karrod wish to speak about?
You are to fight the mighty Karrod soon, %PCname. Do you really have the time to be chatting with me?
Why, hello! My protector has returned! What is it I can do for you, my friend?
So, what information have you uncovered about this mysterious plot my son believes is afoot?
Hello again. I trust things are going well for you.
These are frightening times, friend %PCName. What is it you require?
Good day to you. How may I help you, %PCName?

Greetings %PCName. I've been wanting to speak with you. I understand you've been performing some duties for Tienius, and you've done well. I believe there are other matters you should investigate as well.
Ahh...you are the one recently arrived from Vvardenfell. What is it you wish to ask?
You have other matters you wish to discuss with me? Please, go ahead.
How can Ra'Tesh help you?
What may Karrod do for you, mighty one?
Speak with my King Helseth, my friend. We can speak more when your business with him is complete.
Greetings. How may I help you?
What do you want?
Hello! What can I do for you?
My mother, Queen Barenziah, has been found dead. I understand you were seen near her chambers. You will not leave here alive.
Greetings, %PCName. There is much still to be done for the people of Morrowind, and I believe we will both be needed. How may I help you?

I have been hearing many stories about you, %PCName. And about the goddess. In fact,  I've been hearing stories about a great deal of strange happenings in my city. I sent you to learn more about the attacks. I will assume that the rumors I have heard relate to that.
Yes, %PCName? I thought you were sent to learn more about the attacks. I also told you to stay away from the Royal Palace until you had learned all there is to know! Do not take this job lightly.
You have questions about my plans for you?

Enough! I have seen you fight my champion, though I find it hard to imagine how you have succeeded. I did not believe anyone could best Karrod, but you have shown me otherwise. And he speaks! There are depths to you, %PCName, that I will fathom in time. For now, you have proven yourself to me.
Have you come to fight my champion? Are you prepared to face Karrod?
It is not yet time to fight my champion. Return later, and we will have the battle.
Have you come to be of service to your King?
I understand you were able to protect Barenziah.
Your job is to protect Barenziah. See to it.
Ahhh...%PCName. Have you learned more about that plot?

Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. I had wished to speak with you, but I have learned that my mother, the Queen Barenziah, has been found dead. And you were seen near her chambers near the time of her death. I cannot let you leave here alive.

Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. You should have brought the information to us directly. Still, you may be of use. We understand you had a slight inconvenience earlier. It appears we were given a bit of misinformation. The Queen Mother has spoken of you as well.

Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. Interesting. You'll have to forgive us for the slight inconvenience earlier. It appears we were given a bit of misinformation. The Queen Mother has spoken of you as well.
You would dare approach us without being granted an audience? Guards!
You've got your shiny blade. Now leave an old spirit to his haunts!
You find that Pyroil Tar yet?
What're you doing down here? Leave an old spirit to his haunts.
I'm glad all that's over.
It is done. Please, can we return to the Temple now?
I am attempting to cleanse the Shrine. Please, don't interrupt me.
I will now cleanse the Shrine of the Dead, I suppose. If I can. Be with me, Lady.
You have killed the Profane? Please take me to the Shrine of the Dead.
Hello. I'm told you will accompany me to the Shrine of the Dead and protect me as we travel together. Our Lady commands it...so I suppose we must go.
Yes? M-must we travel together? Or may I wait here? Or go home? Please?
Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.
Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.
I'm afraid that I have nothing for you, %PCName. You will need to speak with the Lady Almalexia if you have further questions.
What is it? I have been told of no tasks that you may perform in the Lady Almalexia's service.
You're to retrieve Barilzar's Mazed Band, are you not?
Ahhh...Fedris sent you to me, did he? You would like to know more about Barilzar's Mazed Band? I suppose I can tell you something.
Yes...have you come to be of service to our Lady?
What is it? Have you settled that business with the Shrine of the Dead?
Hmmm...yes. You are the one that Hler mentioned. Interesting. You are to be of service to our Lady. It is essential, and all would be displeased were you to fail.
What do you want?
What is it you need? I have no more jobs for you, but the Lady Almalexia has informed me that you may report to her directly.
Have you been able to investigate the disturbance further?

I understand you've spoken to Delitian about the attacks on the city. He is correct in having you investigate the disturbance, but you should bring any information you find to me. This is a Temple city, and this is a Temple matter. We will deal with it.

I've heard about the attacks on the city. Good that you reported them to me, though. I've sent some High Ordinators to deal with the situation. You can help me in another way. I want you to investigate the disturbance.
What is it you want?
Have you retrieved Barilzar's Mazed Band?
Drin sent you to me? Priests...hmph. As it happens, there is another way you may be of service to our Lady Almalexia.
Yes...what is it you want? I heard you'd taken care of that shrine business. Go speak with Drin. He seems to like you.
Yes? Aren't you supposed to be dealing with the Shrine of the Dead?
It's you again. I suppose you wish to be of further service to our Lady?
Well, what's the status with the goblin army? Have you taken care of it yet?

Ahh...you're the one who has recently arrived in Mournhold from Vvardenfell. I was told of your arrival. I understand you had some problems with the Dark Brotherhood. An interesting group...and usually rather effective. I'm surprised you're still alive. Perhaps you have potential, or they sent incompetents. I believe you might be of service to our Lady.
You would dare enter the lair of the Dark Brotherhood? Very well. We will complete our mission here and now. A speedy death to you, %PCName.
Hello, friend. Are you seeking transport to Mournhold again?
It is time for you to go, %PCName. Sotha Sil must be stopped.
Greetings, my dearest servant. You were to forge the blade of Nerevar once again.

Welcome, %PCName. It is time we talked of greater things. I have watched you since your arrival in Vvardenfell, and you have been a strong and faithful servant to me. None but the Nerevarine could have succeeded as you have. How long I have waited for this! My Nerevar, returned to me at last! I have watched from my Temple as others have made the claim, and I have seen them fall. I believe now that you are the one who was prophesied.
Have you eliminated the threat of my poor, mad Missing Hand, and brought peace to Mournhold?

I am well-pleased, good and faithful servant. My people look upon the elements, and see there written a divine testament to my lordship. Did ever any other god display such dominion over the earth and sky? But now... with a heavy heart, I must lay a sad burden upon you. I bid you bring the peace of understanding to my Missing Hand.
In My wisdom I have sent you to activate the Karstangz-Bcharn. Tell me you have accomplished this task for your goddess.
What have you learned about this End of Times cult and their beliefs? Have you served me well in gathering this information?

Greetings, %PCName. It is good to see you again. Dear Fedris has told me more about your work so far here in Mournhold. He suggested I might find your services useful. After some consideration, I have decided that there may be a task for you to complete.
I sense that the danger in the Plaza has abated...for now. Go and speak with Fedris Hler. He will give you further instructions.
There is a disturbance in the Plaza Brindisi Dorom. Investigate it, my good and faithful servant. I shall remain here.
There is much work to be done. Leave me now, my loyal servant. We will speak again soon, I am sure.

So you are the person I have been hearing about. I welcome you to my chapel, %PCName...or perhaps I should call you by another name? But, that is a discussion for a later time. I understand you have done well in my service, and, indeed, a service in my name is a service for all of Mournhold. Now, my faithful and obedient servant, let us discuss Barilzar's Mazed Band.
Yes? Do you seek transport to Vvardenfell?
Greetings, friend, what may I do for you?
MARK: Tribunal Dialogs Above
So there was ANOTHER Velas wizard living in the Velas Manor, eh, %PCName? Brother of the weedy one you killed. And a tough wizard, from what I hear. It's a funny old world, isn't it?

I saw your fight with that wizard, %PCName. That certainly was interesting. I expected, with all the rumors of how powerful and evil he was, that he would be tougher than he appeared. Hmm. He did say his name was Velas, right? There's a Velas manor in Godsreach. Perhaps checking it out would shed some much needed light on this mystery.

Salutations, %PCName. So nice of you to join me in my humble abode. I was all prepared to offer you a nice drink or a bite to eat before we got down to business, but you are late in coming and I don't appreciate being kept waiting, so business it shall be. I can sense you've already made the acquaintance of my unfortunate brother.
Greetings, %PCRace. Perhaps you'd like to hear the latest rumors?

Greetings, fair citizens of Mournhold! I am the great, renowned, respected, and feared wizard, Ovis Velas! In the coming weeks you shall see more and more of me, as I bring this city to its knees. But for the moment, allow me to demonstrate my power on one of your hapless countrymen. You there! Yes, you, you ugly %PCRace. Prepare yourself to feel my wrath!
Time to die, %PCRace.
GAVIN: Tribunal Dialogs Above
Don't be tiresome. I have no time for idle chatter with the likes of you.

Are you speaking to me, %PCRace? I suppose you want some armor or steel something-or-another, right? Well, why don't you take your sniveling looks and your ungrateful tone and talk directly to the smith? I'm "just an apprentice." I've got nothing to offer the likes of you. I don't belong here.
Hello again, %PCName. I'm loving this job. Thanks so much for recommending it to me! It sure beats those blasted pillows!

Hey there, %PCName! I got the job! Thanks so much for recommending this to me. It's hard work, but I just imagine that every breastplate or shield I turn out is just a thin, hard pillow made of metal, and I get through the day just fine. Here, I don't have much money, but I can offer you some tools that might come in handy.  Also talk to my boss, Bols. He's pretty happy at having a new apprentice, and will give you some good deals.
Damn that Ilnori Faustus! Damn him!

Thank you so much for sending Therdon my way, %PCName. He's a tremendous help around the place, even if I can't ever get him to shut up about the blasted pillows! Now, can I interest you in my custom armor?

Thank you so much for sending Therdon my way, %PCName. He's a tremendous help around the place, even if I can't ever get him to shut up about the blasted pillows! Now, can I interest you in my custom armor?
Thank you for mentioning that job opportunity at the smithy's to me, %PCName. I hope to check it out very soon, as soon as I finish my shein.
Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor? I see you've already made the acquaintance of my "charming" apprentice, Ilnori Faustus.
Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor? I notice you've had the misfortune to meet my "charming" apprentice, Ilnori Faustus.
Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor?
Hi there, %PCRace. Care to drink away your troubles with me?
Sorry, there, %PCRace. I don't have any spare change.
Get away from me, you slackjawed, flea-bitten %PCRace.
Thank you for helping me with Holmar, %PCName.
That was quite satisfying, %PCName. I'm sorry I had to involve you this way, but I'm glad this problem is taken care of once and for all. Please accept this money as a sign of my gratitude.
That was quite satisfying, %PCName. I'm sorry I had to involve you this way, but I'm glad this problem is taken care of once and for all. Please accept this money as a sign of my gratitude.

As much as I would like to bash his kwama-cuttle-infested head in, I have to hand it to you, %PCName. That was some smooth handling. I doubt he'll be back here any time soon. I don't have much to give in thanks, but here, take this money.
Thank you for showing me the true way of faith, %PCRace. All praise Vivec!
Let's go get that scrib-sucking Nord before he leaves the bar, %PCName.
Here is your book back, %PCRace. I shall forget this incident with the Nord and commit my life to spreading the wisdom of Vivec. Here, take my possessions. I no longer need them.

Ah, welcome back, %PCRace! Praise to Vivec five times and five ways. Thank you so much for lending me this book! It has renewed my faith. As you can see, I have renounced my worldly possessions. "I shall neither hoard nor steal, nor encumber myself with profitless treasures, but shall share freely among house and hearth."
*Hiccup*... Okay, okay. I was just going anyway. Just let me finish this drink....

*Hiccup*... What's that? Who's ... *hiccup*  Who's there?  *hiccup*  Gimme another drink, you cockamamie bastar ... *hiccup*.  Hey ... Hey, this must be about that blasted Wood *hiccup* Elf I just tossed out of here, right?  *hiccup* Hehehehe *hiccup*  Stupid little Wood Elves. Back, *hiccup* back for another round, eh?
*Hiccup*... Hey, where's my sujamma? What's taking so long.... Oh. You don't look like the... pulican. Pelican. Publican. That's it. Publican. Get outta my way. HEY? Where's my SUJAMMA?
Damn that villainous, clay-brained Nord! I hate him! I swear by the teeth of Molag Bal himself I'll have revenge on that corprus-licking ignoramus.
I'm not entirely done with the book yet, %PCName. Give me just a bit more time with it.

That was a great idea, %PCName. Maybe we can get the bartender to clear him out of here now. Thank you so much. I don't have much to offer, but here, take this money and my ring as a sign of my gratitude.
Salutations %PCRace! Would you like to look over my wonderful collection of clutter? Perhaps you would even consider helping me fill out my collection.
Ah, hello again, %PCName. Feel free to take a look around at my collection.
Oh, you again. Come to view my collection and wonder what glory might have been your, eh?
Greetings my Champion of Clutter!
Salutations, %PCRace. I don't need any more help right now. Are you maybe looking for beds for rent?
Salutations, %PCRace. Can I help you find something? Looking for beds for rent? Perhaps you'd be interested in helping me with some work I need taken care of?
Have you taken care of all the problems out there, %PCName?
You still haven't taken care of your bouncer duties, %PCRace. I can spot one drunk from here. Head back out and make sure this place is free from troublemakers like that.
Hello there, %PCRace. Up for a game of shells?
Hey, hey, watch it there. *hic*  Why're you harrass...  harrass...  harassin' me? I ain't done nothing to you *hic*. Damn you, you dirty %PCRace. Always . . . *hic* always causing problems.
%Name welcomes you.  Perhaps you'd like %Name to tell you the latest rumors, yes?
Enjoying the fight, %PCRace?
Hello again, %PCRace.  Sadly I've been unable to find anyone else willing to help me with repairs, so there will be no bot fights for a while, I fear.
Thank you again for saving me, %PCName.
Thank you so much for disabling my haywire bots. I most likely owe you my life. Here, please accept this gold as a reward. I've got some rebuilding to do.
Help! HELP!!! The bots have all gone crazy! HELP!!!
Help me! Help me please! I don't know what happened. My containment gate shattered, and all the bots suddenly started attacking! Disable them for me and I'll pay you well. Look out behind you!
Ah, welcome back, %PCRace.  Are you ready to help me repair my bots?
Thank you for helping me repair my bots, %PCName.
Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.
Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.
Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.
Well, I'm sorry %PCName, but I guess you can't win them all. Good luck in all your endeavors, and thank you for helping me repair my bots.
Ah, welcome back, %PCRace. Are you ready to help me repair my bots?
Not just yet, %PCRace. I need some time to fix my bots. Come back another time.
As you can see, I've finally got the bots up and running. The fight is about to start. Would you like to make a friendly wager on the outcome?

Hello there, %PCRace. I imagine you've come to see the battles of the Robot Arena. I'm sorry to inform you that there won't be any more battles for some time, unless you think you can help me repair my bots.
Greetings, %PCRace.  Have you, by any chance, ever been to the Robot Arena?

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

Dear, dear Thrud. What have I done? I've never found a more faithful friend... and now I shall never hear his voice again. Thank you, %PCName. I owe you my life. But... please... let me be alone with Thrud now.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.
Thank you, thank you, thank you. Thrud hears that you save his friend Dilborn. Thrud happy, Dilborn happy, ALL happy.
Thank you, thank you, thank you. Thrud happy, Dilborn happy, ALL happy.
You try help Thrud free Dilborn. But Dilborn gone. Thrud sad. Now Thrud got books, but not got Dilborn. Thrud stay here now and pray to book spirits so Dilborn not be lonely.
Dilborn back! Dilborn back! Dilborn, Thrud says Dilborn never go to sewers again! Here, %PCRace. Take Thrud's favorite book. It is very good... many words... on BOTH sides of pages.
Dilborn back! Dilborn back! Dilborn, Thrud says Dilborn never go to sewers again! Here, %PCRace. Take Thrud's favorite book. It is very good... many words... on BOTH sides of pages.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.

Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.
Help! Help me!
You've got your Dilborn. Not how I'd spend my money, frankly, but that's your affair. And now, though it's been charming chatting with you, I won't keep you....
The underworld is my world, %PCRace, where we do things my way. This is no place for you. So why don't you go someplace else?

Oh, you again. Come to rescue your little debt-ridden friend, perhaps? How are you doing down there, Dilborn?  Not so well, eh? Well, that's what happens to people who owe me money and neglect to pay.

Well, well, look what the scrib dragged in. I suppose you're here to rescue our little Dilborn, eh? Then I suggest you don't make any sudden moves. You see, when people owe me money, I get a bit touchy. Attack me, and my men have orders to kill Dilborn first -- poor, naked, defenseless Dilborn. But if you're here to settle Dilborn's debts, we may be able to work something out.
Hello, nice lady! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.
Hello, nice man! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.
Go sewers now, %PCName. Thrud see Dilborn go there.
Hello, nice lady! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.
Hello, nice man! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.
Thrud not want to talk. Thrud sad. Friend Dilborn gone.
You don't want to talk to me.  Talk to the boss, Drathas.
You don't want to talk to me.  Talk to the boss, Drathas.
I'm not selling you any more of my trained beasts. You don't take good enough care of them.

Greetings and welcome, sera! Are you in the market for trained scribs and rats? I think you'll find my prices quite reasonable, and my rats and scribs are fine as pets or beasts of burden -- or as tasty little morsels.
GET OUT RIGHT NOW!
You KILLED him! I didn't want him dead! *sob* Get out! GET OUT NOW!
You killed her! You killed Velyna! It was my wife that paid you to do this, wasn't it?! I'll KILL you!
Get out of my sight.

Who are you? What are you doing following me? My wife sent you, didn't she! I knew she was spying on me, and for no good reason, either! That woman doesn't take her eye off me, not even for a short trip to the bar.  Well, you can tell that no-good wife of mine that we're through, %PCRace. And don't let me catch you following me ever again.
You! Why were you following Taren around?  I saw you, so don't try and deny it. You were sent by his wife, weren't you?  Well, I'll deal with that woman after I deal with you!
What are you bothering me for? Please leave me alone.

Who are you? What are you doing following me? My wife sent you, didn't she! I knew she was spying on me, and for no good reason, either! That woman doesn't take her eye off me, not even for a short trip to the bar. Well, you can tell that no-good wife of mine that we're through, %PCRace. And don't let me catch you following me ever again.
Taren is dead?! What were you thinking!? Oh no! *sob* What will I do? I didn't want him dead! *sob* Get out! GET OUT NOW!

Welcome, %PCName. Do you have any news? What's that? You caught my husband cheating and killed the woman? Goodness. I should have realized.... But I must admit, you have handled the problem very... efficiently. Here, please accept this money as a reward. I will deal with Taren myself when he gets home.
All right. If you don't have the time, you don't have the time. Forget about it.
Hello again, %PCName. Any news? Did you see my husband?
Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... I'll thank you to leave... immediately.
Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... I'll thank you to leave... immediately.
Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... but since you're here... you haven't happened to see my husband around anywhere, have you?
Yes, %PCName. You handled things very... neatly. I will deal with Taren myself when he gets home.
Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?
I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.
I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.
Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.
Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.
Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?
Get out there right now, %PCName!

You're late, %PCName. I am not pleased with you, but the show must go on. All you have to do is head out there, stand still, and deliver your lines. There's not a whole lot of action in the play, so don't get too caught up in moving around. And be careful, the audience knows the play well, and I'll be counting your mistakes. You've already got one strike for being late. Good luck!
Good job, %PCName. You're right on time. Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?

Good job, %PCName. You're right on time. Let's get this show on the road. All you have to do is head out there through the door, hit your mark in the center of the rug next to Gureryne, stand still, and deliver your lines. Move quickly through the door -- timing is everything. And be careful, the audience knows the play well, and I'll be counting your mistakes. Break a leg!
You're right on time, %PCName. But what have you done with the script? I'll need it back from you before we go any further. Let me know when you've got it.

Greetings, %PCRace! I'm Meryn Othralas, founder of the Mournhold Players. I'm sure you came here to watch our production of "The Horror of Castle Xyr." Well, I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today. The troupe has its own drama to worry about at the moment.
That was an incredible performance!
That was an incredible performance!
What an incredible performance!
What an incredible performance!
I wonder when the play will start.
I wonder when the play will start.
I wonder when the play will start.
I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.
That wasn't bad... considering the circumstances. You were very brave.
I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.
Oh, my, what's going on? Why did he attack you? Maybe you should talk to Meryn!
What's going on?
Hi %PCRace. You probably want to talk to Meryn backstage. He's in charge of our little troupe here.
Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.
I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.
You have nerve, I must say. But you must be crazy if you think I'll buy artifacts from you that you've stolen from me.
Welcome back to the Museum, %PCName.  Are you here to look, or did you wish to sell something?
Greetings.  I am Torasa Aram, Curator of the Mournhold Museum of Artifacts.
Filthy %PCRace! That note belongs to Ahnia!
What does %PCRace want from Ahnia?
Ahnia does not know you, so Ahnia has nothing to say to you.
I'm sorry, %PCName, but I don't think I'll be needing any more of your, ah, 'help'. Excuse me.
You don't think I'm actually going to talk to you, do you %PCName?  Don't think I've forgotten what you did.  Now get lost!
Ah, %PCName. My good friend!
%PCName, don't you have somewhere....else to be?  You're making me nervous. We can talk tomorrow. Now if you'll excuse me.
Hello, %PCRace.  No time to talk, I'm afraid.  There's much work to be done. Yes, much to do..  No time for silly fancies, like drinking, dancing... oh, but what I wouldn't give to meet someone new.
%PCName! There you are! I wanted to thank you for helping me find Marena Gilnith!
Oh, hi %PCName. Listen, thanks for trying to set me up with Marena Gilnith, even though it didn't work out.
%PCName! There you are! I wanted to thank you for helping me find Marena Gilnith!
Hey, look. This really isn't a very good time; I'm right in the middle of my date! Come see me tomorrow after it's over.
Sorry, %PCName; I can't talk now. I have to get ready!
Confound it, %PCName! Are you determined to make this harder than it is? Leave us alone. I can talk to you some other time.
You'll have to come back later on, %PCName. I need time to, ah, prepare for this meeting of yours.
Hey, %PCName. I was just thinking about heading over to the bar, since that whole Marena Gilnith thing didn't work out. Nice try on your part, though.
Hey there, pal! I wanted to thank you for setting me up with Marena Gilnith. It's worked out better than I ever thought it could.
Hey there! Listen, I'm right in the middle of putting my charms on her, so why don't you catch up with me tomorrow? That is, if I'm not still busy.  Know what I mean?
Hello, %PCName. No time to talk now. Have to get ready for the big date!
Hey there, friend! Been out cruising the streets? Because I sure have! The women aren't safe when I'm on the town!
Back again?  You just can't get enough of me, can you?  Don't worry - it happens to all the women at one time or another.
Well, hello there.  Aren't you a tasty dish?  You must be new to Mournhold.  I'd have recognized that beautiful face otherwise.  Fons Beren at your service, milady.  A man who loves beautful women.
Well met, friend!  You're not a familiar face... new to Mournhold, are you?  Don't suppose you arrived with any female friends, eh?  I get on quite well with the women, you know.
Pardon me, friend.  But I'm not feeling very talkative right now.  Perhaps some other time?
Hi, %PCName! So, did you talk to Marena Gilnith? Did she say anything about me?
Hi there, %PCName! Are you having as good a time here as I am?
Hi there.  Wow.  Can you believe this place?  It's just... amazing.  Everything's so beautiful!  The buildings, the shops, the women...  I'm blown away!

Well, well, well. Look who it is! My dear friend %PCName. Just my luck that you should stumble in here. Heh. Indeed, it seems my good fortune knows no bounds. Despite my mis-treatment at your hands, I've found riches, been able to influence just about anyone I talk to, and can you believe I've NEVER lost a fight? Never even gotten a scratch. Somehow I don't think I'll have a problem continuing that streak... and I owe you!
Don't just stand there, %PCName! Get rid of these rats! They've all been infected!

Hello, %PCName. Interested in the rumors circulating around the city? I can say that I consider them to be exaggerations of the truth. Several people have fallen ill lately, to be sure, but it is hardly the epidemic people are making it out to be. As long as you're here, however, perhaps I could ask a small favor of you.

I wonder if I could trouble you for a moment of your time, %PCName. I don't know if you've heard the rumors going around about a disease; I can say that I consider them to be exaggerations of the truth. Several people have fallen ill lately, to be sure, but it is hardly the epidemic people are making it out to be. Regardless, I wondered if I could ask a small favor of you.
Nothing to worry yourself about, citizen. Just some crazy woman. Move it along.

%PCName! You've got to do something! I stepped out for a bit of fresh air, only to hear the door lock behind me! There was some horrible screaming a few minutes ago, but it's gone all quiet now, and no one has answered when I've pounded on the door. We've got to get in there!
It's safe... too heavy to open. Water will get me past though... just turn the crank....
I can sneak past.... red eyes won't see me... won't hurt me...
I'll be safe down there.... thieves won't find it... won't find me...

I'm sorry you had to see that. She's been like this for months now, and no one can seem to get through to her. We have no idea what "it" is, or why she's become so paranoid about it. Any attempts to discuss the matter with her have ended badly. Some even violently. That's why we bring a guard with us when we visit. As a friend of the family, I can't just leave her to her own devices. I've heard, however, that she was seen talking to Elbert Nermarc recently. Perhaps he might know more.
I think you should speak with Golena Sadri before I say anything. It.... well, it will be clearer to you that way.

I know you.... you're one of THEM! You can't fool me! Well, you'll never get your hands on it! It's safe from the likes of you! From all you thieves! There's nothing for you here; just get out. GET OUT!
No, no. No way out. One way in. It's safe. No one can find it.
I do hope there's something you can do to help poor Golena. There's simply no reason for this madness!
Greetings, I am Tadera Andules. Are you an acquaintance of Golena Sadri? If so, perhaps you'll have better luck talking to her than we have...
No offense, but I don't have anything else to say to you. Don't want to get into any more trouble than I already am. You'd better go.

Funny how this all turned out, isn't it? Never thought I'd end up here. Well, at least we're safe from Dovor. He got in the way when we tried to leave, so I had to take him down. I'm better off this way. At least, I think so...  Oh, and your name never came up. I talked to Felvan ahead of time, and made sure of that. So, I guess it's all over.
Dovor! NO! I'll skin you alive, %PCRace!
Look, there's nothing to say. Might as well just leave me alone.

Well, we did it. Turned ourselves in. Yup. And we didn't say anything about you, so you're not in trouble or nothing. *sigh* Dovor didn't like it, and he got mad. Olvyne hit him real hard, and we ran when he fell down. I hope his head doesn't hurt too bad. Oh, well. I guess there's nothing left to say.
You....you killed Dovor! I'll get you!
Shunari has thanked brave %PCName for helping, and for killing evil Gedna Relvel. But now Shunari must go.
Has brave %PCName defeated Gedna Relvel?
Ahh. Shunari feels much better. And now Shunari will tell %PCName all about Gedna Relvel.
Good %PCName has returned! Is %PCName here to help Shunari?
Why has %PCName killed guard? Now Shunari will be blamed! Shunari only meant to knock guard out, not kill him!

Please hurry. Shunari is weak, and needs to be cured. She cannot go upstairs, or else guards will see her and take her to prison. Shunari is not safe here, and will meet %PCName in Temple Gardens instead.
Shunari must speak with %PCName! She has seen things, oh yes, things that %PCName needs to know! Quickly, before guard wakes up!
You again! Gah! I've rid myself of the others; none of you will get it! It's mine, I tell you, all mine!
OW! Vicious thug! I'll get you! I'll..... I'm getting out of here!
I won't forget you. Get out of my sight!
Oh, it's YOU. What, have you come to run me completely out of business?
Welcome, %PCRace, welcome! The best deals in all of Mournhold can be found here. Low prices every day, and special offers as well! Please, take your time and look through my wares.
No time to talk, %PCRace. Excuse me.
Hello, %PCName.  Is this about the Estate Sale again?
Hello, %PCName.  I hope the dagger has been of use to you, or has been some comfort in Sandas' absence.
Oh, hello there.  I'm terribly busy right now, trying to get everything organized for the Estate Sale.
I'll have nothing further to do with you, %PCRace. You are a liar, and most likely a thief as well. Now remove yourself from my home, lest I summon the guards to deal with you!
Yes? Is this about the Estate Sale? I'm not quite ready for it yet, you see.
Hello.  If you're here about the Estate Sale, I'm afraid a date hasn't been set yet.
It seems you're the only one with any reason around here, %PCName.
They won't let me in! I'm sick man, and the bastards WON'T LET ME IN!
CHAPPY: Tribunal Dialogs Above

So. She has sent you for me. Now YOU are Her favorite. How convenient. Whichever of us dies... she will be well pleased. And if both of us die, so much the better. Well, I am content. Perhaps this is how it was meant to end. I ask the forgiveness of all the gods and spirits -- whoever they may be. And you, too, might make your peace with your gods, because at least one of us will not live to see another sunset.
I do not want company. Go away.
You! You killed my mother!
You! You killed my father!
I'm true to my word. I said I would not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. That's what you wanted, and that's what you've got. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....

I said you could go. So go. But I warn you -- don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....

Well. I must say, you've done your research. You've located Granny Varis and Gee-Pop Varis. I value truth -- but I value the lives of my parents more highly. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

Hmm. You are a shrewd judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. But I know what benefits gold can do if it is used in a good cause. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And I'll take your 3000 gold, and will contribute it to the Widows and Orphans Fund. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

And you don't HAVE 3000 gold right now? I suppose you plan to get it to me 'right away'? Why don't I trust you? Well, thank you for your generous offer, but I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.

You are not a very good judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.
Of course you're right. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.

I know you by reputation, %PCName. You've done some remarkable things. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.

'Honest.' So you expect me to trust you? My experiences with trusting adventurers like you have been disappointing in the past. But... this time, you may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.
I haven't printed lies about King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. I've only printed the truth. And I intend to keep on printing the truth in 'The Common Tongue' -- unless you think you can stop me.
Scripts: Choice "I think killing you will stop you." 5 "I think a gift of 1000 gold will stop you." 6 "I think a donation of 3000 gold to the Widows and Orphans Fund will stop you." 7 "I think threatening your aged parents will stop you." 8

Scripts: Choice "I think killing you will stop you." 5 "I think a gift of 1000 gold will stop you." 6 "I think a donation of 3000 gold to the Widows and Orphans Fund will stop you." 7

Lines.Text: What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.
Scripts: Choice "You will stop printing lies about King Helseth." 1 "Excuse me. I'm just an honest working burglar, and I want no trouble." 2 "I'm looking for the Eye of Argonia." 3 "My mistake. I'll leave, and keep your secret. Honest." 4

Lines.Text: What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.
Scripts: Choice "Excuse me. I'm just an honest working burglar, and I want no trouble." 2 "I'm looking for the Eye of Argonia." 3 "My mistake. I'll leave. Honest." 4

Lines.Text: All the trees and plants, tended lawns and paths, are hymns of praise to Almalexia's name. It's humble work, sera, but I'm very proud of it.
This temple is clean as Almalexia's conscience, sera. And mind you keep it that way.
Talk to the boss. I'm just hired help.
Don't talk to me. Talk to the boss. We just work here. But don't try anything funny, or we'll settle with you the hard way.
I have nothing to say. You want to talk, talk to Varis.

Hello there.  I suppose you've come to trade, and that's fine with me.  Azura knows there's little else in the world worth doing.  None of the rest of it matters...  adventuring, fame, women.  It's all pointless.
If you're here to offer your respects, speak to Ravani Llethan, the king's widow.
Murderer! Take that!
If you're here to offer your respects, speak to Ravani Llethan, the king's widow.
Thank you for visiting with me in my time of grief.
Leave me alone with my grief.
What do you want?
But... I don't understand. Is something the matter?
I am Forven Berano. But I don't see how that matters to you.
Murderer! Take that!
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.
There are no more official matters to discuss. You are to report directly to the King himself.

I sent you to investigate the disturbance, and you reported your findings to Hler. Disappointing. I have no more official matters to discuss with you, but His Royal Highness King Hlaalu Helseth wishes to speak with you.
Well, have you been able to investigate the disturbance?

I understand you've reported this attack on the city to Fedris Hler. I agree you should investigate the disturbance in the ruins of Bamz-Amschend and seek out the source of the attacks. You may report your findings to me. This is really a matter for the Empire to deal with.
I have heard about the attack on the city, and I've dispatched guards to take care of it. Thank you for your report. You can help in another way. I'd like you to investigate the disturbance.
I'm the captain of King Helseth's Royal Guards. Is this an official matter? Or is there something else you want?
Yes, %PCName. Is this an official matter? Or is there something else you want?
[He looks you over slowly and deliberately.] Excuse me.
[He seems amused, but determined not to speak to you.] I said... EXCUSE ME.
If you have heard the latest rumors, perhaps someone of your abilities and experience could find it in your heart to help the community.
Give to the Temple, and receive the blessings of Almalexia.
I have delivered my message. Now I can be at peace.
Stranger! Listen! I have a message I must tell you!
You killed Variner's Ghost? How could you? Now I will never know what message he might have given me!
Thank you, %PCName. It can't console me for my loss, but you have set Variner Areloth's spirit to rest.
Beware the Black Dart gang, adventurer. They've robbed me of everything I hold dear.
KEN: Tribunal Dialogs Above
Forget it. I'll never work for you again.
I quit! I warned you! I told you I work for profit, and I won't be robbed! I'll never work for you again!

I'm badly wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

I'm wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

I like a little workout, %PCName. But I'm wounded, and you want to keep me at full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?
What do you need, %PCName? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?
Hello again, %PCName. As you can see, I'm once again available for hire.

I'm badly wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

I'm wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

I like a little workout, %PCName. But I'm wounded, and you want to keep me at full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?
What do you need, %PCName? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?
If you're looking for someone to watch your back, I'm available for hire.
Can't talk now, %PCRace.  I'm waiting for someone.
I'm sorry, but I'm very busy.  I don't have time to talk.
Hey, %PCName.  I saw you talking to Felvan.  The two of you looked pretty cozy.  What's going on?  You're not scared or something, are you?
Look %PCName, our business is done.  We don't really have a reason to keep talking.  So if you have something to say, say it to Dovor.
So?  Did you find Bels Uvenim?

Dovor said to see me?  Well, err, he said... I mean, there's this guy, and I'm supposed to ask for.. I mean, I want his stuff, right?  Dovor says you can get it.  I don't want to know anything more than that. Go find Bels Uvenim and get his spear and his helmet. He's probably hanging around the Temple. That's it.
Look, I'm not in charge.  Talk to Dovor, okay?
We're friends, right?  Well, just between friends, I'm a little bit scared.
Hi again, %PCName. I don't think there's anything else I'm supposed to say to you. So I guess you'd better go talk to Dovor.
Oh, hey. You were doing something for me, right? Oh yeah. That. Have you found Elanande yet?

Dovor said to talk to me?  Oh..  Umm...  well, if he thinks I should get some new stuff, then maybe I should.  I know that Elanande has some real nice equipment.  I like that robe of hers, and one time I saw the axe she has.  Looks really pretty.  Hmm.  Dovor said she doesn't deserve them, and that they'd be better for me than her.  Dovor's always right, you know.
Dovor is in charge.  You'd better talk to him.
You kill my companions, and expect civil conversation? You scum!
You kill my companions, and expect civil conversation? You scum!
I told you not to come back, didn't I?  I'm afraid I can't tolerate this disrespect, %PCName.
Hello, %PCName.  I see you've accomodated Olvyne's wishes.  Nicely done.  Now, if you could assist us one last time, we'd be most thankful.
Well then, %PCName.  You were able to get what Felvan needed?  Excellent.  You're certainly welcome to continue to assist us, if you wish.
Ah, %PCName.  Our comrade in arms, our ally in the fight for freedom!
You've no business being here, %PCRace.  I suggest you turn around, go out the way you came in, and forget you ever saw us.
This weather is odd, but nothing to be concerned about. Go about your business.
This weather is odd, but nothing to be concerned about. Go about your business.
This weather will pass. The goddess will protect us. Move along.
Ashstorms here in Mournhold! Why has Almalexia not done anything about this? She must make it end!
Ashstorms here in Mournhold! Surely the goddess will protect us from this!
This weather is awful! I don't know how the Bazaar is staying open!
I can't believe these ashstorms! I've heard of them on the island, but not here in Mournhold! How can this be?
Ashstorms here in the city? How can this happen? This isn't Vvardenfell! Something must be done quickly!
These storms are odd, but it will pass. There is no cause for alarm.
I'm certain this weather will clear up soon. There is no reason to panic.
I'm certain this weather will clear up soon. There is no reason to panic.
This weather is unbelievable. What can it mean? This isn't supposed to happen here! Not again!
I can't believe these ashstorms! I've heard of them on the island, but not here in Mournhold! Why does this keep happening?
Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.
Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.
Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Fons Beren!
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Sunel Hlas!
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!
There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!
Hello again, %PCName. The arrangements have been made, I take it?
Hello there, %PCName! Any luck helping me meet someone new?

Hello there, %PCRace! Before you take another step, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Gaenor, and I'm... well, I'm an entrepreneur of sorts. I was wondering if I could ask a small favor of you.
Weakling! You dare to cross my threshold? You, then, will be the first to fall, before the undead army sweeps across this land like a plague, cleansing it of your flesh.  Die, mortal!

The winds have whispered to me, %PCName. They have told me of your failure to enter Hrothmund's Barrow. In order to become chieftain of Thirsk, you needed to enter the barrow and grasp the axe of Hrothmund to receive his blessing. Now, that will never happen. This is a sad day. I fear Thirsk will never reopen.
You...you mean to tell me you found the entrance to...to Hrothmund's Barrow...and...and uttered the WRONG name? You...you idiot! Get away from me.... You...you're obviously completely incompetent!

All hail %PCName, the chieftain of Thirsk! What can I do for you, my lord. Perhaps there is some mead hall business you'd like to tend to? Or maybe you'd rather just go upstairs and rest in your quarters?
You killed my Brandr! Why?!
Have you met my love, Brandr?
You've killed her! You've killed the only woman I've ever loved! Now you will pay!
Let me introduce you to Erna. She and I have a love my wife would never understand.
All hail the new sheeftain of Thirshk! *burp!* Becaushe of you, the mead hall ish open again! Here'sh to your health! *burp!*

[Bathmar plays his lute and sings the praises of the new chieftain of Thirsk] In the cave she met the beast, and cut quite short its evil feast! And when the Udyrfrykte did fall, the chieftain came and claimed her hall! The danger gone the mead did flow, and everyone at Thirsk did know, that %PCName would rule great Thirsk until the end of time!

[Bathmar plays his lute and sings the praises of the new chieftain of Thirsk] In the cave he met the beast, and cut quite short its evil feast! And when the Udyrfrykte did fall, the chieftain came and claimed his hall! The danger gone the mead did flow, and everyone at Thirsk did know, that %PCName would rule great Thirsk until the end of time!

So, you travel the wilds of Solstheim, just as I do? Here's a word of advice from one wanderer to another -- keep your eyes open and your wits about you. There's more than bears and wolves roaming about this island. If you find yourself face to face with the berserkers or fryse hags, sheathe your blade and get to running! If you need shelter, my kinsfolk at Thirsk will gladly take you in.

Oh.  I see.  I thought I sensed honor in you, %PCName.  It is why I offered you this chance at glory.  Perhaps I was wrong about you....  If you have a change of heart, return to me and we will fight valiantly to the death.  And don't worry. I'm not going to ambush you.  In order to enter Sovngarde I must die in valiant combat.  I will not lower myself to cowardice and deceit as Grimkell did.  Now leave me, %PCName.  I have much to consider.
Need to get back to Fort Frostmoth? Wouldn't you rather take a boat than walk? My price is reasonable.

You honor me with this decision!  Songs will be written of our glorious battle!  It is true that in my heart I wish to be defeated, so that I may enter Sovngarde.  But know, this %PCName.  I will fight, and fight valiantly, as I have all my life.  You will probably die by my hand.  I will grant no quarter, no mercy, and I expect no less from you.  Go now. Prepare for battle.  When you are ready, speak with me again, and then we shall engage in armed combat!

New theories, you say?  Let me see the book you speak of.  Hmmm.... Could this be?  Is it possible the entrance to Sovngarde lie right before me all along?  It makes so much sense!  %PCName, you've done it!  You've found the way to Sovngarde!  All I need to do is die valiantly in combat!  But how....  I know!  You, %PCName!  You must help me!  You must defeat me in armed combat and send my soul to Sovngarde!  Tell me, will you honor me with a fight to the death?
Scripts: Choice "Sorry, Ulfgar, I can't help you." 2 "I'll help you, Ulfgar.  I will do everything in my power to defeat you in armed combat." 3

Lines.Text: Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

Welcome back, %PCName.  I hope Solstheim has been treating you well.  So tell me...have you managed to locate the entrance to Sovngarde?  Ha!  Of course you haven't!  I searched for five hundred years and never succeeded!  You know, there's a part of me that feels Sovngarde doesn't even exist....

Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

*cough!*  %PCName...  *gasp!*  You...you did it...  You defeated me!  *gasp!*  You have... *cough*  opened the gates to...to Sovngarde!  *gasp!*  I...I can see them before me....  My brothers...my brothers are there!  *cough!*  I must go now, my friend.  *cough!*  Go...go to Brodir Grove.  If I can... *gasp!*  ...I will return to you there.  I will.... *gasp!*  ...reward you for...for everything!  Must go...now... *cough!*  I'm coming, my comrades! *cough!*  I'm cccooo..... *gasp!*
Ah, a visitor.  It's been quite a while since I've had any company, friend.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.
%PCName, I...I wasn't sure you'd return.  Tell me...have you come to accept my offer, and engage me in a fight to the death?
Scripts: Choice "Sorry, Ulfgar, I can't help you." 2 "I'll help you, Ulfgar.  I will do everything in my power to defeat you in armed combat." 3

Lines.Text: Welcome back, %PCName.  I hope Solstheim has been treating you well.  So tell me...have you managed to locate the entrance to Sovngarde?  Ha!  Of course you haven't!  I searched for five hundred years and never succeeded!  You know, there's a part of me that feels Sovngarde doesn't even exist....
Scripts: Choice "Actually, Ulfgar, I came upon this book.  It's called 'Sovngarde, a Reexamination,' and seems to offer new theories on how one may enter Sovngarde.  I think it may have the answers you seek." 1

Lines.Text: I have been waiting for you, %PCName.  The hour of battle is upon us.  I hope you are well prepared to engage such a worthy foe as myself.  I have roamed the land for five hundred years, leaving death in my wake.  And although I have been brought to the brink of death on more than one occasion, still I live.  It is my hope, %PCName, that you are my match, and will send my soul racing to Sovngarde.  Now, we test our mettle!  To arms!

Hail, %PCClass. Svenja Snow-Song is my name. We welcome guests here at Thirsk, so long as they behave themselves. Respect my home and my clan, and we'll get along just fine. Normally I'd tell outsiders to stay clear of Erich the Unworthy, but I see that won't be necessary now, will it?
Good to see you again, %PCName.  I hope our fair island is treating you well enough.
Lead on, %PCName.  The undead beast roams the halls of the Valbrandr Barrow.
Hello, %PCName.  I was just going over my notes.  I'm here on Solstheim doing some research, you see.
Hello, dear %PCName. It is so cold outside! Come in and warm yourself. Maybe a nap would help restore your strength?
%PCName, you have returned. I'd ask if you have extracted wergild from Sigvatr the Strong, but I know that is too much to hope for.
I'm sorry, %PCName, but I'm not in the best of spirits. As you know, my Gustav was murdered and I seek wergild as compensation for his death.
Please leave me be, %PCRace.  I don't mean to be rude, but I've suffered the loss of my son, and don't want company right now.
You again.  What do you want?
Ask your questions but be quick, %PCClass.  I'm quite busy with the moon sugar investigation.

%PCName, you've returned.  The fact that you're not carrying a white Colovian fur helm leads me to believe that the moon sugar poisoner is still at large.  Please hurry.  If one more person is victimized by this scoundrel, it could mean my job.  And that would make me most unhappy.

%PCName!  Do my eyes deceive me, or is that a white Colovian fur helm?  Then the deed is done.  The moon sugar poisoner has been brought to justice.  Excellent work.  The Imperial Legion will not forget you, or your assistance.  Here, please take this gold as a symbol of our thanks.

%PCName!  Do my eyes deceive me, or is that a white Colovian fur helm?  Then the deed is done.  The moon sugar poisoner has been brought to justice.  Excellent work.  You have done a great service to me, the Legion, and the Empire itself.  Take this gold as payment for a job well done.  And I would also give you another reward, as a symbol of my personal thanks. This shortsword has served me well, and you'll find its enchantments will help rally others to your cause.
Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my brother-in-arms?
Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my sister-in-arms?
Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my friend?
He he!  Ha ha!  Can it be?  A visitor in my workshop?  How can I help you, sweet %PCName?  I have candy treats to spare, if you come in search of happiness!
Ha ha!  What's this?  Why it's little %PCName, come to pay Uncle Sweetshare a visit!  I've been a good boy, %PCName!  I promise!  He he he he he!

%PCName!  You did it!  By helping me die valiantly you showed my soul the way to Sovngarde!  My friends -- Hunroor, Erlendr, and Nikulas -- have been waiting for me.  I told them of your willingness to help me, and recounted our glorious battle!  The four of us wish to give you a reward fitting of such a warrior.  So, we give you a piece of ourselves.  Lay your hands on a stone, and you will receive that warrior's greatest attribute!  Now farewell, my friend!  Sovngarde awaits!

Hello, stranger. I don't see many sightseers out here. The cold and horkers drive most people away. Me, I just come here to watch the sea. I used to be a ship captain, you know. But that was before...before that night at sea.
I'm sorry, but I'm not in the mood for visitors right now.  Just look at this mess, %PCCLass.  Do you see what that foul draugr has done?  He has ruined my dwelling and stolen away my only friend.

%PCClass, you've returned!  Oh, I see you haven't found Oddfrid White-Lip.  I do hope the draugrs haven't proved too much for you.
