What is it you want, vampire? Have you convinced my son of the error in his thinking?
Greetings, Child Killer. I assume you have come here because of my son.
Very well. What do you want?
I will not speak with your kind, vampire.
Scripts: Choice "I have the potion you ordered." 1

Lines.Text: I will not speak with your kind, vampire.
I will not speak with your kind, vampire.
Do you plan to serve me again, Darkling?
You try my patience, accident.
What is it, little monster? How does an abomination such as you plan to serve me?
Yes, little monster. What do you want?
What is it, abomination? It is only because you have Berne blood in your veins that I do not kill you where you stand. The ways you may serve me are limited.
Greetings, my dark friend. Welcome to the Brood of Lord Irarak.
What is it, Blood Friend? How may the Lord Irarak be of service to you?
You are another of the master's kind. Welcome, dark one. Welcome to the lair of Lord Irarak.
You try my patience, monster.
What is it, Fresh Blood? You have no place here in the house of Quarra. You are of very little use to me.
What is it you wish, lifeless one?
What do you want, New Blood?
Please. No.
Speak quickly, yearling.
Do not hurt me, dark one.
Don't waste my time, accident.
I submit to your will.
Mistress Dratha has no more words for you.
Have you retrieved the Quarra Blood Potion yet?
Have you taken care of Rimintil, vampire?
Ahhh...one of the dark ones. You are an interesting lot. Mistress Dratha has a task for you. She would like the Altmer named Rimintil eliminated.
I have nothing further about which I wish to speak to you.
Have you found my vampire dust yet, lifeless thing?
I wanted to have someone killed. Did you do it, creature?
Though I find your kind abhorrent, you can serve a purpose for me. I wish to have someone killed.
Hello again, vampire. Have you convinced my son?
A vampire. How quaint. There are certain experiments I've had in mind for one of your kind. What is it you want?
Hmmm...a vampire. Interesting. What is it you want?
Say your peace and leave, vampire. We will not have you killed, but your presence here is...a nuisance.
Your kind is not welcome here, vampire. I have nothing I wish to say to you. Speak with Sirilonwe. She seems to have an affinity for your kind.
Your kind is not welcome here, vampire. Ask me what you will, and be on your way.
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Yes? What do you ask of your fellow vampires?
Vampire! I curse you, in Almsivi's name, and in the name of all the ancestors. Return to the foul corruption from which you came! Die, fiend!
Vampire! I curse you, in Almsivi's name, and in the name of all the ancestors. Leave my sight, unholy beast!
Vampire! I curse you, in Almsivi's name, and in the name of all the ancestors. Leave here, monster!
Remarkable. A vampire. In Morrowind. And still alive... so to speak. [Chuckles.] If you're looking for a vampirism cure, I can't help you. But I can tell you where to start looking.
Remarkable. A vampire. In Morrowind. And still alive... so to speak. [Chuckles.] If you're looking for a vampirism cure, I can't help you. But I can tell you where to start looking.
I don't fear you, vampire. Begone, fiend.
No! A vampire! Get away, you foul creature!
Get away from me, vampire!
Cover yourself! Are you mad? Have you no decency?
Traitors to the %Faction must die.
We've been expecting you.
We've been expecting you.
Whatever trick this is... You'll taste my spells.
The Morag Tong is weak! I shall defeat you!
You're no match for me!
Die, Morag Tong scum!
The Morag Tong will pay for this insult!
What are you doing here?
The Morag Tong! They found me! Help! Please... spare me!
You're time has come, %PCRace!
Die, %PCRace!
Whatever it is, it can wait for another day. Goodbye.
I'm sorry. I busy right now.
You're no match for me, Morag Tong puppy!
What? No... You're from the Morag Tong! You won't take me!
Die, outlander!
I don't like the way you've been looking at me.
I've worked with those brothers for years. I won't let you get away with this!
I've worked with those brothers for years. I won't let you get away with this!
Killing my best men was a mistake, %PCName.
Don't give me a reason, %PCName.
Don't give me a reason, %PCName.
Don't give me a reason, %PCName.
Don't give me a reason, %PCName.
You... you're from the Morag Tong. You... you must be here to kill Toris.
I want no part of this. Good day.
You're from the Morag Tong, aren't you? Mavon Drenim is upstairs, but she's been expecting you. Don't tell her I warned you.
So you've finally arrived. I will not interfere.
I can't officially take any action against you, but you killed a fellow Hlaalu, and I will not forget it.
Just... just... get out of my club.
I liked Guril Retheran, but I don't want any trouble with the Morag Tong.
Whatever you're doing here is none of my business. Just don't take anything that's not yours.
I don't care who you are. If you ever do anything like that in my club again, you'll be sorry.
I don't know who you are or what argument you had with Feruren, but I want no part of it.
You are afflicted with corprus disease. I am a healer, but I know of no cure for corprus.
You are afflicted with corprus disease. I am an apothecary, but I know of no cure for corprus.

I'm sorry, %PCRank %PCName, but you are afflicted with a blight disease. I am an apothecary. Among other services, I sell a potion that cures all blight diseases. Members of your rank may also receive the free blessing of a cure by visiting a Temple shrine. A blessing costs you nothing, but a potion may be carried for convenient use.

I'm sorry, %PCRank %PCName, but you are afflicted with a blight disease. I am an apothecary. Among other services, I sell a potion that cures all blight diseases. Members of your rank may also receive the blessing of a cure by visiting a Temple shrine and making a small offering. A blessing costs less than a potion, but a potion may be carried for convenient use.

I'm sorry, %PCRank %PCName, but you are afflicted with a blight disease. I am an apothecary. Among other services, I sell a potion that cures all blight diseases. You bear the corprus curse, outlander. There is no cure but death. Take yourself to a quiet place and prepare yourself for the end.
You're got corprus disease, outlander. That's a death sentence. It can't get cured. Get away from me. FAR away.
Hey! Get away from me! You've got corprus disease! You can't get cured of corprus! Get aWAY!
Keep your distance, outlander. You are marked by blight disease. Go to a wise woman or trader. They have potions that cure such curses.

Keep your distance, outlander. Can't you tell you're sick? And you've got a blight disease. You're a danger to everyone. Go find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or a healer or apothecary, and get cured.
You're got a blight disease, outlander. Get away from me. And go get cured, or STAY away from me.

Not so close! I don't want to catch what you've got. And you've got a blight disease. You're a danger to everyone. You must find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or see a healer or apothecary, and get yourself cured. Otherwise, no one is going to talk to you.

Hey! Get away from me! Don't you know you're sick? And you've got a blight disease. You're a danger to everyone. Go find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or a healer or apothecary, and get cured.
You are unclean, outlander. You have touched some diseased thing. It is only a common disease, but you must see a wise woman or trader and get a potion to cure it.

I'm sorry, friend, but I think you have managed to get a common disease of some sort. You can get that cured by visiting a Temple shrine, or an Imperial cult altar, or by buying a potion from a healer or apothecary.

Keep your distance, outlander. Can't you tell you're sick? I don't want to catch your disease. You should get cured, or no one will want to talk with you. Go find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or see a healer or an apothecary.
You're unclean, outlander. Get away from me. And go get cured, or stay away from me.

I'm sorry you're not feeling well, but you need to get cured of that disease. I think it's just a common disease, and if you go to an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or see a healer or apothecary, I'm sure they can take care of it.

Not so close! I don't want to catch what you've got. It's just a common disease, but you need to find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or see a healer or apothecary, and get yourself cured. Otherwise, no one is going to talk to you.
Hey! Get away from me! Don't you know you're sick? It's just a common disease. Go find an Imperial cult altar or a Temple shrine, or a healer or apothecary, and get cured.

Personally, %PCName, I really respect you. But you are a notorious outlaw, and until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, I will become increasingly reluctant to associate with you.
If you have been seen carrying out the Morag Tong's orders, you should speak with a guard and present your writs. Your crimes will be cleared.

Personally, %PCName, I really respect you. But you are a notorious outlaw, and until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, I will become increasingly reluctant to associate with you.

Personally, %PCName, I really respect you. But you are a notorious outlaw, and until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, I will become increasingly reluctant to associate with you.
Yes? Is this about that work we discussed earlier?

Personally, %PCName, I really respect you. But you are a notorious outlaw, and until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, I will become increasingly reluctant to associate with you.
We will have nothing to do with a notorious outlaw. Until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, don't talk to us.
We will have nothing to do with a notorious outlaw. Until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, don't talk to us.
We will have nothing to do with a notorious outlaw. Until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, don't talk to us.
The Morag Tong does not respect those who debase the sacred art of murder.
We will have nothing to do with a notorious outlaw. Until you have cleared your name, or paid your debt to society, don't talk to us.

What are you? A savage barbarian? The Mages Guild is a civilized society of scholars, not a dark coven of necromancers and outlaws. We are very disappointed in you. Either you clear your name of these crimes, or pay your debt to society, or we will have to deny you shelter or services.

What are you? A savage barbarian? The Mages Guild is a civilized society of scholars, not a dark coven of necromancers and outlaws. We are very disappointed in you. Either you clear your name of these crimes, or pay your debt to society, or we will have to deny you shelter or services.

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. %Name don't know the details, and don't want to know. But %Faction won't be pleased. We're judged by your actions, and we don't need thugs like you getting us a reputation as murderers.

This bad person who threatens Ahnassi, this Daren Adryn is... not around any more? And, so because you share a care with Ahnassi, you have such price on your head? This is wrong. You do this for Ahnassi. Ahnassi has friends, calls in favors... promises she will set this thing right.

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. %Name don't know the details, and don't want to know. But %Faction won't be pleased. We're judged by your actions, and we don't need thugs like you getting us a reputation as murderers.

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. I don't know the details, and don't want to know. But %Faction won't be pleased. We're judged by your actions, and we don't need thugs like you getting us a reputation as murderers.

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. I don't know the details, and don't want to know. But %Faction won't be pleased. We're judged by your actions, and we don't need thugs like you getting us a reputation as murderers.
You have a price on your head. A very high price. Go see a guard and see your name is cleared. If you're going to be stupid, or careless, be prepared to pay the price.
You are a notorious outlaw among your people. That means nothing to us. We know killing very well. But you walk a thin line with us, outlander. So walk very carefully.
I know you. You're %PCName. The notorious outlaw.... Let me outta here.
I know you. You're %PCName, the notorious outlaw. Look. I don't want any trouble. But you're scaring me. And I can't think straight when I'm scared.
I know you. You're %PCName, the notorious outlaw. Look. I don't want any trouble. But you're scaring me. And I can't think straight when I'm scared.
You've got the corprus! There's no cure for that, is there?
You've got blight disease! Get that taken care of soon, %PCName. You're the only case I've seen on this island.
You don't look well at all. If you're sick, you'd better get over to the Imperial Shrine at Fort Frostmoth.
You look like you're dying, and I've never seen anyone with that sort of disease. I don't know what it is, but you look to be dying. Leave here.
You're sick, but I've never seen this disease before. You must have brought it with you to this place. Get it cured fast.
You reek of disease. You should get yourself cured of whatever it is that ails you.
There's a great sickness within you, the likes of which I have never seen. You should leave this place.
You've got a disease that I've not seen before. It must have been brought here by you or one of the Imperials. Get it cured. Now. We don't want your diseases in this place.
You're not well. You should get yourself cured.
You've got the corprus! Stay away from me. I've heard there's no cure for that. You should head back to Vvardenfell. We don't need that at the fort.
You've got the blight disease, %PCName. Must have picked it up on Vvardenfell. You'll want to get that taken care of quickly.
You're not looking so good. Sick, I mean. You probably want to go to the Imperial Shrine and get that taken care of.
What the...? You're sick, and I don't want whatever it is you've got!
You've got the blight disease. You must have come over here recently from the big island, %PCRace. Get that taken care of. We don't need it around here.
You've got some sort of disease, %PCRace. Something's just not right with you. And that's not a good sign around here.
Pardon me. But there's a very strange man in my house, and he won't leave. Will you go get him out of there, please?
You are the one who took care of that strange man in my house? Thank you. I'll tell everyone how kind and brave you've been.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
It is the Hour of Wakening. Dagoth Ur awakes, and comes forth in his glory, and his people shall rejoice, and his enemies shall scatter like dust.
You can look, but don't touch. Yes, it's all Dwarf-make. And it belongs to Master Aryon. So keep your hands to yourself.
I don't get paid to answer questions.

Welcome to the Sadrith Mora Temple. No... we are not Telvanni wizards. Look, I wear the vestments of the Temple. Though I understand your confusion. It is rather dark in here. And cramped. And it certainly doesn't look like a Temple, does it? But we do offers the standard Temple services here.
Yes? What can I do for you?

Welcome to our little Almsivi chapel. Pardon our informal surroundings, but we are guests here of House Telvanni, and apparently they have no more spacious, well-lit accommodations available for the Temple faithful. Still, we have all the services you'd expect to find a much larger Temple.
Have you been able to clear my son of Bralen Carvaren's murder?
Yes? What can I do for you?

Welcome to the Sadrith Mora Temple, outlander. You'll excuse the improvised furnishing. Telvanni hospitality. But I assure you, there's nothing second-class about our commitment to Almsivi, or our commitment to faith and service.
Yes? What can I do for you?
Just a friendly warning. Don't spook the netch. Don't worry -- they're completely safe if you don't bother them -- but get them riled up, and they're trouble. Especially the betty netch.
Just a friendly warning. Don't spook the netch. Don't worry -- they're completely safe if you don't bother them -- but get them riled up, and they're trouble. Especially the betty netch.
Just a friendly warning. Don't spook the netch. Don't worry -- they're completely safe if you don't bother them -- but get them riled up, and they're trouble. Especially the betty netch.
Remember. Leave the netch alone, and they'll leave you alone.
Remember. Leave the netch alone, and they'll leave you alone.
Remember. Leave the netch alone, and they'll leave you alone.
I'm a miner in the Shulk Eggmine, but I'm just out here taking a break.
I'm a miner in the Shulk Eggmine, but I'm getting some fresh air.

Hello, %PCName. My name is Vala Catraso, and I run a little class for outlanders new to Morrowind. You may find it easier to get along here if you know a little about Morrowind lore. I'm also a priest, and I'd be happy to talk to you about my trade.
Hello, %PCName. Are you hoping to study a little Morrowind lore with the rest of the class?
Eh, there, kipper? Buy an old reaver a jug of mazte, tell you a little secret?

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. %Name doesn't know the details, and doesn't want to know. But we're judged by your actions, and we don't need a reputation for reckless violence.

With such a high price on your head, everyone assumes you are a murderer. I don't know the details, and don't want to know. But %Faction won't be pleased. We're judged by your actions, and we don't need a reputation for reckless violence.
Does Sjoring Hard-Heart still live?
Were you able to get rid of the brothers Ienith? I know they are powerful foes, but they are a great strength of our enemy.
What is the situation with Hrundi? Will he join our cause? Have you found Hrundi's woman?
Were you able to retrieve the Bitter Cup and bring it to Eydis Fire-Eye?
I sent you to speak to Percius Mercius and see if he was willing to help us fight.
Were you able to locate Nads Tharen and his key?
Were you able to bring the Dwemer Goblet to one more worthy of its value?
Did you deliver those history books in the name of the Bal Molagmer?
You were sent to steal Brallion's Ring and deliver it to Ilmeni Dren. Tell me your status.
Enamor must be returned to its rightful owner. Is this done?
Did you recover the forged land deed, %PCRank?
The Bal Molagmer must end Yngling Half-Troll's corruption. Have you found the ledger?
You were to return the Hlervu Locket, %PCRank.
Well, %PCRank, have you been able to recover the Darts of Judgement?
We still need four pieces of scrap metal to fix the centurions. Have you found some?
Have you returned with a copy of Withershins?
Any luck getting hold of Boethiah's Pillow Book? I'm sure Gandosa has a copy.
Do you have that Redoran Master Helm, %PCRank?
You were sent to fetch Anareren's Devil Tanto from the Guild of Mages. What happened?
You said you wanted to attempt to retrieve Felen Maryon's Staff? Any luck?
You were to retrieve Redoran Cooking Secrets for Fara. Were you able to yet?
I asked you to hire a wizard, %PCRank. Have you done so?
Have you gotten the Grandmaster's Retort for me yet, %PCRank?
You were to deliver that potion recipe to Tusamircil.
It is important we defend the South Wall. Who is the master of security, %PCRank?
Habasi asked you to free our brother. Where is New-Shoes Bragor?
Tell Habasi about the Vintage Brandy. Have you found what Ralen Hlaalo left behind?
Where are the Dwemer Artifacts Habasi asked you to get? Have you found them, %PCRank?
Did you get the Nerano Manor key for Habasi?
Have you found a diamond for Habasi?
Our time is almost upon us. What have you done about the Master Thief?
Thank you. Thank you again. I'm really, really grateful. And I promise -- I'll never get mixed up with smugglers -- or scamps -- again.

Thank you. Thank you again. I wish I had a more suitable reward. But I assure you, I will tell everyone I meet how you helped me, and how you refused any reward. I'm really, really grateful. And I promise -- I'll never get mixed up with smugglers -- or scamps -- again.

Thank you. Thank you again. You have no idea how glad I am to get rid of that hat. And thanks for leaving me the skirt. It's not really my color. But better than nothing. I'm really, really grateful for your help. And I'll never get mixed up with smugglers -- or scamps -- again.

Thank you. Thank you again. The skirt is probably worth a lot. And I understand about the hat. One has to draw the line somewhere. But I'm really, really grateful for your help. And I'll never get mixed up with smugglers -- or scamps -- again.
Thank you. Thank you again. I wish I had a more suitable reward for you. But I'm really, really grateful for your help. And I'll never get mixed up with smugglers -- or scamps -- again.
Thank you for the levitation potion. Very, very much. If you don't mind, I'll just wait here for a while until I calm down. But, as promised, here are the skirt and hat.
Scripts: Choice "Take skirt and hat." 1 "Take skirt, but refuse hat." 2 "Take hat, but refuse skirt." 3 "Let him keep the skirt and hat." 4

Lines.Text: Thank you for the levitation potion. Very, very much. If you don't mind, I'll just wait here for a while until I calm down. But, as promised, here are the skirt and hat.
Scripts: Choice "Take skirt and hat." 1 "Take skirt, but refuse hat." 2 "Take hat, but refuse skirt." 3 "Let him keep the skirt and hat." 4

Lines.Text: Thank you for the levitation potion. Very, very much. If you don't mind, I'll just wait here for a while until I calm down. But, as promised, here are the skirt and hat.
Scripts: Choice "Take skirt and hat." 1 "Take skirt, but refuse hat." 2 "Take hat, but refuse skirt." 3 "Let him keep the skirt and hat." 4

Lines.Text: Thank you for the levitation potion. Very, very much. If you don't mind, I'll just wait here for a while until I calm down. But, as promised, here are the skirt and hat.

Lines.Text: Thank you for the levitation potion. Very, very much. If you don't mind, I'll just wait here for a while until I calm down. But, as promised, here are the skirt and hat.
Scripts: Choice "Take skirt and hat." 1 "Take skirt, but refuse hat." 2 "Take hat, but refuse skirt." 3 "Let him keep the skirt and hat." 4

Lines.Text: Please? Get me a potion of levitation, and I'll give you this very attractive skirt. And this remarkable hat. I'm sure there are several levitation potions around here somewhere.

Please. Have mercy. I was the sorcerer on this job, but the ogrim got out of control. And the scamps slaughtered my companions and served them to me in a broth. And stripped me. And made me wear this outfit. Help me out of here. Please. Get me a potion of levitation -- there're several in here -- and I'll give you... this very attractive skirt. And this remarkable hat. They're all I have.
I can't thank you enough. I wish I had a more suitable reward. If you don't mind, I'll think I had better wait here for a while until I calm down. But I'll be just fine.
Have you done what I asked? Are the Thieves Guild Bosses taken care of yet?
I told you to get rid of Rufinus Alleius. What's the situation?
Have you taken care of Adraria Vandacia? That needs to be taken care of immediately.
You collect on that debt money I sent you for? Where is it?
I gave you the contract on that Khajiit, Dro'Sakhar. He dead yet?
You get Tongue-Toad to shut his mouth yet? I want that done.
I sent you to get the Juicedaw Feather Ring. Where is it?
Have you settled the matter of Sjoring Hard-Heart yet? I pray that this business is ended soon.
We've spoken about the problems with Eydis Fire-Eye already, as well as with Lorbumol gro-Aglakh. Tell me what you have done about the situation.
Have you delivered that flin to the Elith-Pal Mine yet? It is important that it be delivered there as soon as possible, %PCRank.
What's the status of those bandits in Suran? Have you had a chance to speak with Serjo Avon Oran yet?
I sent you to take care of Nerer Beneran. Have you had any success with that yet?
Do you have any new information on the situation in Vas? You should speak to Ulyne Henim.
Well, have you found the Pudai Egg Mine yet? I suppose I can't expect success, but let me know your status.
Have you found Engaer yet? When you do, the bounty is yours.
What is it you want? I have nothing more for you here.
You were sent to escort Sondaale of Shimmerene. Give me the status of your mission, %PCRank.
Have you gotten that shipment to the Dunirai Caverns yet? It is important that it be delivered.
Have you taken care of that Corprus Stalker in Berwen's shop yet? What about that bounty I told you about? The one on Rels Tenim.
What's the status on Rels Tenim? Manage to find him?
Have you taken care of that Corprus Stalker in Berwen's shop yet?
Give me your report on the situation at Dissapla Mine, %PCRank.
What is the latest from Nchurdamz? Have you investigated it yet?
Did you find time in your schedule to visit the Sarano tomb yet? Give me the status.
Tell me what is happening with that Verethi gang. I'll assume you've taken care of it?
I sent you to investigate some orcs at a Daedric ruin. What have you found out, %PCRank?
Give me the status on Dura gra-Bol. Surely you haven't botched up this mission, have you?
Did you recover the debt money from Desele yet? Or have you just been wasting time? Well?
Have you recovered that code book yet? I've been waiting too long for it.
Do you have more information on the Telvanni agents? I need to know.
What's the status on those egg poachers, %PCRank? Don't make me assign this to another person.
Have you taken care of that cave rat problem yet? Surely you can handle even that.
How can I help you, my favorite friend?
You did well, outlander. Thank you.
Well done, outlander. I can report to my mistress that Trerayna Dalen is no longer a problem. I'll mention your name... for what it's worth. Here's your gold. And my thanks.
What's the delay? You want your gold, don't you? Kill Trerayna Dalen, and I'll pay you 1000 gold.

Outlander. Would you like to earn some gold? Take care of Trerayna Dalen for me. She's a petty annoyance, but Mistress Therana won't let me leave the tower to take care of her. Don't be fooled by her thugs. The armor is impressive, but there's not much inside it. Kill Trerayna Dalen, and I'll pay you 1000 gold.
Greetings. I understand you were sent to help with the trouble we're having with bandits in Suran.
Hello again, %PCName. I need someone to fetch me the gold kanet flower that grows in the ruins nearby.
Hello %PCName! I'm still waiting for that gold kanet flower. Not to be pushy, but I don't like to be kept waiting.
Hello %PCName! I'm still waiting for that gold kanet flower. Not to be pushy, but I don't like to be kept waiting.
What do you want?
Are you here for scrolls, %PCName? Or are you here from some other enchantments? Or even soulgems? Whatever your enchanting needs, you've come to the right place.

Step right up, %PCName, and look over my collection of scrolls. How about the flashy and cheap Taldam's Scorcher to burn your foes? Or Ondusi's Unhinging to open stuck chests and doors? If you're going somewhere dangerous, try some scrolls of Vitality and Vigor to restore your and health and fatigue. If you're in real trouble, you'll want Almsivi Intervention or Divine Intervention to transport you instantly to the nearest Temple or nearest Imperial shrine.
Thank you, %PCName, for rescuing me. Now I'll stay here at Holamayan with Master Barelo and assist him with the monastery's library.

Oh. It's you. Well, I hope you're happy. That stupid love potion idea of yours worked, and now look what it's gotten me. She's a monster! Nagging, complaining, spending all my money. How could you let me get into this? Well, what do you want?
Greetings, friend! What a wonderful day! As you can see, all is well with me...or should I say us? Glathel and I are now married, and nothing could be better.
Did you deliver the potion to Eraldil?
Have you spoken to Eraldil yet?
You say you've found a love letter of mine? Oh, dear. That is embarrassing.
Welcome, friend. Perhaps I can interest you in some of my goods? I realize the prices are a bit high, but that is beyond my control.
Greetings, friend. How can I help you? We have an excellent selection of glassware, although getting more exotic items has become very difficult.
Welcome to my shop, friend. Perhaps I can offer you something you need? I'd have more to offer, but for this incredible rat infestation.
Yes. Thank you, %PCName. Thank you for healing me.
Yes? What do you want?
You have killed my love. I have nothing to live for. If I die at your hands, it is no great loss.
I am Volmyni Dral, and this is my home. What do you want from me?
I am %Name, Factor-in-Chief of the Ebonheart agency of the East Empire Company, at your service. Is this concerning the generous pledge I offered to the Imperial cult?
I am %Name, Factor-in-Chief of the Ebonheart agency of the East Empire Company, at your service.
You! Defend yourself!
We have nothing to discuss. Excuse me.
I said I was busy. Perhaps you are hard of hearing?

I am %Name, a principal and charter-holder of the Caldera Mining Company. I cannot imagine why someone like you should think you have business with me, but I will listen, if you can be brief and polite.
You have killed my love. Killing you will not bring her back. But I have nothing to lose.
Leave me. I am diseased. I do not need your help.
Anssswer my riddle, fool. And then fight me!
Answer this riddle for me, mortal. Or does thy blood run cold?
I am your final barrier, mortal. Answer my riddle, and then best me -- if you can.
You again? Didn't you learn your lesson the first time?
I am Anhaedra. If you are a pilgrim, read the inscription on the stupid rock.
What brings you here, %PCName?
Greetings. I am %Name, the caretaker of the Sanctus Shrine.
Thank you for curing me, %PCName. I'd get out of here if I were you.
Argh! Must I constantly be tormented by ... AAAH!! ... Leave me! I am diseased and I must suffer in solitude!

Ho there! Your one of Hrundi's band, aren't you? I can spot you a mile off. I've been waiting for some time now for assistance, but I suppose you will have to do. I'm on a quest to root out a "great beast" dwelling within these ruins. You and I will explore together.
What's that? Do you require aid?
Leave me to grieve, Outlander.
Greetings, %PCName. Have you finished running an errand for me?
Welcome, %PCName. Perhaps you are interested in running an errand for me?
Are you here to get rid of the Corprus Stalker?
Yes? Do you need another leaflet?
What can this poor merchant do for you? I've had very little business recently, with the terrible haunting in my shop.
How may this poor trader help you today? My prices are reasonable, as I've recently had a run of bad luck.
Greetings, friend. I understand you've had some dealings with the Company before. Perhaps you'd like to be of further assistance?
Greetings, traveler. Perhaps I might interest you in some wares? Although, it is hard to work with my poor husband gone missing.
Were you able to get that contract for me?
Welcome to my shop, stranger. It is good to see paying customers, especially with all the competition these days.
Hello, my friend! What a glorious time it is. Perhaps I can interest you in one of my fine wares. All magical, all for a low, low price! A man in my line of work must find a way to make a living!
Welcome, %PCRace. It is good to see a customer in the store. That annoying fool outside chases them away.

Well, hey there. S'fine place this is, huh? S'fine place. Good place for me to jusht forget about my troubles. No use thinking about them. Stupid slaves. Why they gotta run? Huh? Sure, be nothing to do if they didn't. But why the gotta hide, too?
Greetings! Perhaps you can help me. I was supposed to meet my business partner here, but I was running late, and it looks she went ahead to Molag Mar without me.
Go about your business now! The master waits! Fork fork fork. Stabbing meat, lovely meat.
Hello %PCName! I hope you'll be able to speak to Trebonius soon and offer my apologies. This rash is killing me!
Hello, my friend. I'll be off to find Maurrie soon. Thank you for your help.
Well, are you going to cast that spell on me, slaughterfish?
Yes? Huh? What is it? I'm sorry...things had been so muddled, but my mind is much clearer.

Blessings of the Nine, %PCName. Piernette Beluelle told me about you. I am Ygfa, Fort Pelagiad's Healer, and an Adept of the Imperial cult. I barter for potions and other goods, and can teach a number of spells. All proceeds go to the benefit of the Imperial cult and its many worthwhile projects. From what Piernette told me, you should join the Imperial cult.

Blessings of the Nine, %PCName. I am Ygfa, Fort Pelagiad's Healer, and an Adept of the Imperial cult. I barter for potions and other goods, and can teach a number of spells. All proceeds go to the benefit of the Imperial cult and its many worthwhile projects. Would you like to join the Imperial cult?
Hello. Thank you again for returning my bowl. Now, can I help you find a specific place here in Pelagiad? Or services? Or someone in particular? Would you like a little advice?
Hello. My name is Piernette Beluelle. Can I help you?
Yes? What do you want? If you're looking to get out of Seyda Neen, I'll be happy to give you a little advice.
I haven't seen your %PCRace face before. Would you like a little advice? Or are you looking for someone in particular?
You were supposed to find Fargoth's hiding place. Were you able to?
You look like you could use a friend, outlander. Perhaps I can be your friend. I'd like you to help me recover some gold.
What do you want? Don't bother trying to rob me. The Imperials have taken everything anyway.
What? What is it? Are you following me? Leave me alone!
Are you the one that boat dropped off? Odd to see a boat arrive at that time of the day. Hope the Imperials treated you okay. I swear they took my ring.

Welcome to Arrille's Tradehouse. I barter for goods or coin. I also have a small selection of spells for sale. No credit. You want a little advice? That's free. That's ALL that's free. Would you like to hear about our most popular potions? Our most popular scrolls?
Ho there, good friend!
Blessings of the Nine, %PCRank %PCName. Did you wish to barter for potions and other goods? Or do you hope to learn a new spell?
Good luck on the mountain. Go with Kynareth. And don't forget my old lucky coin.
Hello. They call me Wulf. What brings you to Ghostgate?
Right. I'm Wulf, like I said. I was wondering what you were doing here in Ghostgate.
Yes! That is my ring! Please! It grants me Divine Intervention! Now I can escape! Give it to me NOW! I don't care about anything else... just let me out of here!
Yes! That is my ring! Please! It grants me Divine Intervention! Now I can escape! Give it to me NOW! I don't care about anything else... just let me out of here!
Yes! That is my ring! Please! It grants me Divine Intervention! Now I can escape! Give it to me NOW! I don't care about anything else... just let me out of here!
Bring me my ring! BRING ME MY RING!

Please. Llaren Terano is a sorcerer and worshipper of Molag Bal. He is a terrible sorcerer, but he also carries a deadly sword. He stripped me and made me his prisoner. That's all I can remember. I can't recall how I got here, or why. I think he has poisoned my mind with spells. If you can recover my ring from Llaren Terano, I can use its enchantments to escape. Please, rescue these slaves, too, if you can. Llaren Terano has their slave key. Bring me my ring. Please.
So. Have you brought me a Divine Intervention scroll?

I'm SO glad to see you! I'm a healer, and I had been making my way to Gnisis from Ald'ruhn when these two winged twilights snatched me from the road, bore me into the air, dragged me deep beneath the earth, and stranded me on this high pillar of rock. I prayed to Mara for Divine Intervention. You must have been sent in answer to my prayers.
So. Have you brought me a Divine Intervention scroll?

Praise the Nine! Have you come to my rescue? I was seeking trade opportunities with the Ashlanders when I was attacked by outcast outlanders. I was separated from my bodyguard, and took refuge in this cave, where I was seized, robbed, and held by this battlemage, Galmis Dren, to be sold as a slave. I prayed to Zenithar for Divine Intervention. You must have been sent in answer to my prayers.
You have been expelled from the cult again, and for the last time. The cult is finished with you and your false repentance.
I'm sorry, %PCName. But perhaps you'll reconsider, and come to us again.

We are all weak. But your humble contrition is praiseworthy. You are once again a member of the Imperial cult. But I caution you. Do not again forget yourself, for there is no further recourse if you should be expelled once more.
You've been expelled. If you heartily repent your misdeeds, we will give you a second chance -- only one second chance -- to return as a member of our community. Do you wish to atone?

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have done well, %PCName. You have kept your oath well, and faithfully served me in the Oracle's Quests. If I need your help again, I shall send word for you through others of high rank in the cult.

This is Skull-Crusher? It is indeed marvelous. But I can detect no evil curse upon this weapon. It is safe, I assure you. Perhaps it is only a legend. Perhaps we can perceive the hidden motions of the gods in this. Receive my special blessing, so you may dedicate yourself further to the service of the Nine. That's all the quests I have for you. If I need your help again, I shall send word for you through others of high rank in the cult.

This is Skull-Crusher? It is indeed marvelous. But I can detect no trace of any evil curse upon this weapon. Perhaps it is only a legend. Perhaps it is a blessing, and not a curse, that preserves it from thieves. And perhaps we can perceive the hidden motions of the gods in this. It is safe, I assure you. Receive my special blessing, so you may dedicate yourself further to the service of the Nine. And speak to me again when you are ready for another of my Oracle's Quests.
%PCRank %PCName, I believe it is your fate to recover the long-lost artifact Skull-Crusher. When you have this legendary weapon in hand, bring it to me so I may bless it.
%PCRank %PCName, Stendarr has granted me a vision of the artifact Skull-Crusher.

By killing Carecalmo and Meryaran you have avenged the deaths of the healer Urjorad and his master Dro'farahn Stiff-Neck, and rid the world of a great evil. You have served the Imperial cult well. Please take these Gauntlets of Glory, and put them to good use. Speak to me again when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.

I am glad you were able to recover this scroll. It is an item of terrible power, and I am glad it has not fallen into evil hands. Thank you for completing this task. As to the matter of Carecalmo and Meryaran, I leave that matter to your judgement. As opponents, they may be too great for you. Speak to me again when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.

I asked you to recover a powerful artifact called the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting and to return it to me. When you have the scroll, or when you have slain Carecalmo, the ancient High Elf priest of the Daedric shrine of Ashalmimilkala, and his powerful High Elf bodyguard Meryaran, return to me.

%Rank %PCName, the healer Urjorad is overdue and presumed dead. He went to the Daedric shrine of Ashalmimilkala with a powerful artifact called the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting. Signs say he has come to grief inside Ashalmimilkala. Go find his body, recover the scroll and return it to us. Or, if you would risk your life to complete the quest that took Urjorad's life, use the scroll to slay Carecalmo, the shrine's ancient High Elf priest, and his powerful High Elf bodyguard Meryaran.

%Rank %PCName, the healer Urjorad is overdue and presumed dead. He went to the Daedric shrine of Ashalmimilkala with a powerful artifact called the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting. Signs say he has come to grief inside Ashalmimilkala. Go find his body, recover the scroll and return it to us. Or, if you would risk your life to complete the quest that took Urjorad's life, use the scroll to slay Carecalmo, the shrine's ancient High Elf priest, and his powerful High Elf bodyguard Meryaran.

%Rank %PCName, the healer Urjorad is overdue and presumed dead. He went to the Daedric shrine of Ashalmimilkala with a powerful artifact called the Scroll of Fiercely Roasting. Signs say he has come to grief inside Ashalmimilkala. Go find his body, recover the scroll and return it to us. Or, if you would risk your life to complete the quest that took Urjorad's life, use the scroll to slay Carecalmo, the shrine's ancient High Elf priest, and his powerful High Elf bodyguard Meryaran.

Adusamsi Assurnarairan has told me how you rescued her, and begs me to give you this as a token of her gratitude. From what she says, your task was not easy. And you also managed to recover the Ice Blade of the Monarch, which I hope you will keep and dedicate to the service of the Imperial cult. I celebrate you, and your courage and determination. Thank you again, and speak to me when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.

Adusamsi Assurnarairan has told me how you rescued her, and begs me to give you this as a token of her gratitude. From what she says, your task was not easy. I celebrate you, and your courage and determination. And if you manage to find the Ice Blade of the Monarch, you should keep for your own use in the service of the Imperial cult. Thank you again, and speak to me when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.
Please, rescue Adusamsi Assurnarairan from Rotheran, and, if possible, bring me the Ice Blade of the Monarch.

I want you to go to the Dunmer stronghold of Rotheran and rescue Adusamsi Assurnarairan the Oracle. She went there to recover the Ice Blade of the Monarch. Rescue Adusamsi Assurnarairan and return to me. While you are in Rotheran, recover the Ice Blade of the Monarch, if possible, and bring that to me, also.

You have done the deeds of a hero. It is a sign that you were meant to keep the boots for yourself, to keep them safe, and to dedicate them to the service of the Nine. And from what you tell me of this healer Ama Nin, I suspect you may have spoken with the goddess Mara herself, disguised in mortal form to test you. Congratulations. Such chance meetings are a sign of the Nine's favor. Speak to me again when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.

You have done the deeds of a hero. It is a sign that you were meant to keep the boots for yourself, to keep them safe, and to dedicate them to the service of the Nine. Congratulations. Speak to me again when you are ready to undertake another of the Oracle's Quests.
Do you have news of the Boots of the Apostle? Find the boots, and bring them to me.

%PCRank %PCName, I have need of you again. I've been granted a prophecy of the Boots of the Apostle, a legendary treasure of Cyrodiil, relics of Tiber Septim who was also called Talos. "Through the doors of Berandas, within the silent caverns, beneath the wings of twilight, dust sleeps in the shoes that Talos wore." Recover the Boots of the Apostle and bring them to me. A Dunmer savant or Dunmer scout may have clues to the meaning of the prophecy.
Do you have news of the Ring in Darkness?
Welcome, %PCRank %PCName. You have dedicated yourself to the service of the Oracle. Speak with me now, and I shall acquaint you with my vision of the Ring in Darkness.

Welcome, %PCRank %PCName. You have proved yourself faithful and resourceful. I am an Oracle of the Imperial cult. Sometimes I am granted visions. I have the gift of Seeing, but not the gift of Doing. If you are bold, a doer of deeds, I beg you -- dedicate yourself to the Oracle's Quests, and I promise your rewards shall be great in the sight of the Nine.

I will return Julielle Aumine's amulet to her husband as she requested. Then I shall wait for her spirit to visit me again. At that time, I am confident that I can lay the ghost of Julielle Aumine to rest. So thank you again, for all you've done.

Yes, this is Julielle Aumine's amulet, as her husband described it to me. I shall return it to him. May the Nine bless you for your deeds. Return to Kaye, and tell him that now I am sure I can lay the ghost of Julielle Aumine to rest.
When you have killed the four smugglers who murdered Julielle Aumine, and found her stolen amulet, bring me the amulet, and I shall see that her spirit is laid to rest.

Thank you for coming. I have been visited by the spirit of Julielle Aumine. She says she chanced upon a band of smugglers, and was murdered to seal her lips. She says that her spirit will not rest until her amulet is recovered and returned to her husband, and until the four smugglers who murdered her are slain. When I have Julielle's amulet and you have the lives of her murderers, I shall see that her spirit is laid to rest.
Thank you again for ridding me of that ghost. I really appreciate it.

Bless the Nine! And you! Thank you for ridding me of that ghost. Since it's not a haunted house any more, now maybe I can get some sleep. And don't worry about the trap door. I'll just leave it alone. Completely alone. My thanks to you. And to the Imperial cult.
Please, let me know when the ghost's gone. I haven't had a good night's sleep in weeks.

Yes. I'm the one with the haunted house. The Imperial cult said they'd send someone to take care of the ghost. I suspect it has to do with the trap door. The landlord told me not to fool with it, but he didn't say why -- although now I can guess. The landlord gave me a key -- here. Please, let me know when the ghost's gone. I haven't had a good night's sleep in weeks.
I don't know what you're talking about. You say you found a bowl in my shack? Well, you're a liar. So go away. And leave me alone.
I don't know what you're talking about. You say you found a bowl in my shack? Well, you're a liar. So go away. And leave me alone.
Yes. I was treated for swamp fever at the Imperial Chapels in Ebonheart. But I don't know anything about a Chapel Limeware Bowl. So go away. And leave me alone.
Expelled again? No, don't bother to explain. I don't want to hear it. Just go away.
I'm sorry to hear that, %PCName. But if change your mind, come back and talk to me.
Your offenses are forgiven, but not forgotten. You are once again a member of the cult. But do not fail again, for there will be no second chance for forgiveness.

You've been expelled. But the cult is willing to give you a second chance -- ONE last chance -- to prove you are truly sorry, and that you will never again commit crimes against fellow cult members. Do you beg forgiveness, and promise to reform?

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

I have no more shrine sergeant missions. Speak to Synnolian Tunifus or Iulus Truptor downstairs, if you haven't already. I have given your name to our Oracle here, Lalatia Varian. She may have some more difficult challenges.

I appreciate your asking, %PCName, but I have no more shrine sergeant missions for you. If you haven't already considered being one of our lay healers or almoners, I suggest you speak to Synnolian Tunifus or Iulus Truptor downstairs. I have also passed your name to our Oracle here, Lalatia Varian. She may have some more difficult challenges to interest you. But it's always good to see you, and if there's anything I can do for you, let me know.

So Okur needed you to kill the smugglers who murdered Julielle Aumine and to recover the dead woman's lost amulet. Well, if Okur is sure she can lay the ghost to rest now, that's good enough for me. And, as it happens, I just received a donation of magic scrolls. Let me give you these three. Thank you. That's all I have for you. But there might be work for lay healers or almoners, or you might talk to Lalatia Varian about Oracle's Quests.

Hmm. Quitters never prosper, %PCName. This is not a way to get into the cult's good graces. Don't come back looking for more missions for at least a day. Get your priorities straight before you ask me again for a shrine sergeant mission.
Good. I'll be waiting.
Let me know when you've helped Okur take care of the ghost of the murder victim.
Scripts: Choice "I'm still working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too difficullt for me." 2 "I took care of everything just as Okur told me." 3

Lines.Text: Let me know when you've helped Okur take care of the ghost of the murder victim.
Scripts: Choice "I'm still working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too difficullt for me." 2

Lines.Text: You've found Linus Iulus' Silver Staff of Shaming, and his Maran Amulet and Stendarran Belt. I think you should keep the staff, in honor of Linus Iulus' sacrifice. And we'll pass on the amulet and belt to some new lay servant. And as an additional reward for your service, here is a Restoration shirt. It will keep you fresh during heavy exercise, like long-distance running or tough fights. Thank you for your exertions on the cult's behalf, and when you're ready for another mission, speak to me again.

Thank you for retrieving the Silver Staff of Shaming. To honor Linus Iulus' memory, we will pass it on to some faithful servant of the Imperial cult. And as a reward for your service, here is a Restoration shirt. It will keep you fresh during heavy exercise, like long-distance running or tough fights. Thank you for your exertions on the cult's behalf, and when you're ready for another mission, speak to me again.

Hmm. Quitters never prosper, %PCName. This is not a way to get into the cult's good graces. Don't come back looking for more missions for at least a day. Get your priorities straight before you ask me again for a shrine sergeant mission.
Good. I'll be waiting.
I told you not to come back for a full day. And understand -- if I do give you another shrine sergeant mission, you had better take your commitments more seriously.

An Argonian named Okur in Hla Oad has asked for our aid. This devout follower of the Nine is sensitive to spirits of the otherworld, and she says she is being visited by the ghost of a murder victim. The guards can't do anything in such cases. Go and speak with Okur. Here's some gold for expenses. If possible, discover the nature of the crime, and bring justice to wronged spirit so it can be laid to rest.
Have you found the Silver Staff of Shaming that belonged to Linus Iulus?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too difficullt for me." 2 "I have the Silver Staff of Shaming." 3

Lines.Text: Have you found the Silver Staff of Shaming that belonged to Linus Iulus?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too difficullt for me." 2

Lines.Text: I'm glad to see you back in one piece. Since I didn't know how tough she was.... Anyway, you're back, and Thelsa Dral is out of the way. I've been thinking. These shrine missions are getting tougher, and I thought you might like to have this old ring. I don't use it anymore, but it came in handy several times when I was younger. Take it, with my thanks, and when you're ready for another mission, speak to me again.

Hmm. Quitters never prosper, %PCName. This is not a way to get into the cult's good graces. Don't come back looking for more missions for at least a day. Get your priorities straight before you ask me again for a shrine sergeant mission.
Good. I'll be waiting.
I told you not to come back for a full day. And understand -- if I do give you another shrine sergeant mission, you had better take your commitments more seriously.

An acolyte named Linus Iulus disappeared some years ago. He was last seen leaving Suran headed east on foot for Zafirbel Bay. Recently our oracle, Lalatia Varian, has had a vision of a Silver Staff of Shaming, and Linus Iulus had one of these staves. Here is a Detect Enchantment ring and 100 gold for expenses. Go to Mount Kand. Find a Silver Staff of Shaming there, retrieve it, and bring it to me, along with any other personal effects you find that belonged to Linus Iulus.
Have you found and killed the witch Thelsa Dral in Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too dangerous for me." 2 "The witch Thelsa Dral is dead." 3

Lines.Text: Have you found and killed the witch Thelsa Dral in Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is too dangerous for me." 2

Lines.Text: So. You've taken care of that haunted house problem for Nedhelas. Very good. I hope the 200 gold I gave you covered your expenses. And here's something else for you. When I have a choice, I like to go around trouble, rather than into trouble, and these scrolls come in handy for that. When you're ready for another shrine sergeant mission, speak to me again.

Hmm. Quitters never prosper, %PCName. This is not a way to get into the cult's good graces. Don't come back looking for more missions for at least a day. Get your priorities straight before you ask me again for a shrine sergeant mission.
Good. I'll be waiting.
I told you not to come back for a full day. And understand -- if I do give you another shrine sergeant mission, you had better take your commitments more seriously.

Not long ago we drove a coven of witches from the old Daedric ruins of Ashalmawia. However, one witch escaped -- a Dark Elf named Thelsa Dral. But just recently egg miners from nearby Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine have complained that the mine is cursed. Perhaps Thelsa Dral has taken refuge there. Go to Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine, near the village of khuul, and if you find the witch Thelsa Dral, kill her. When you are sure the wicked creature is dead, return and report to me. Here is some gold for expenses.
Have you taken care of that haunted house for Nedhelas in Caldera yet?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is just too hard for me." 2 "Yes, I took care of the haunted house." 3

Lines.Text: Have you taken care of that haunted house for Nedhelas in Caldera yet?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but this mission is just too hard for me." 2

Lines.Text: So you found Caryarel? And recovered our bowl? Well done! Here. Let me give you something to cover your expenses. And here are a few Divine Intervention scrolls. I never go anywhere without them. And when you're ready for another shrine sergeant mission, speak to me again.

Hmm. Quitters never prosper, %PCName. This is not a way to get into the cult's good graces. Don't come back looking for more missions for at least a day. Get your priorities straight before you ask me again for a shrine sergeant mission.
Good. I'll be waiting.
I told you not to come back for a full day. And understand -- if I do give you another shrine sergeant mission, you had better take your commitments more seriously.

A Bosmer named Nedhelas in Caldera says his house is haunted by a ghost. You'll need an enchanted weapon or suitable spells, because only spells, enchanted weapons, or refined weapons like silver daggers can harm a ghost. I don't know what you prefer, so take these 200 drakes. Buy something that suits you, and use the rest for expenses. Talk to Nedhelas first, and report back to me if you get rid his haunted house of its ghost.
Have you recovered our Chapel Limeware Bowl?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find that bowl." 2 "Yes, I have the bowl right here." 3

Lines.Text: Have you recovered our Chapel Limeware Bowl?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find that bowl." 2

Lines.Text: Hmm. That's too bad. I could sure use some help here. But... go ahead. What can I do for you?

Good. I could use a little help here. We treated a High Elf named Caryarel for swamp fever, but we later discovered that while he was here, a rare Chapel Limeware Bowl disappeared from our shrine. Will you find this Caryarel and retrieve our bowl for us? The High Elves are a small, tight-knit community on Vvardenfell. Try asking other High Elves if they know Caryarel and where he lives.
Hello, %PCRank %PCName. My name is Kaye, and I'm in charge of the volunteer shrine sergeants for the cult. Are you ready for a shrine sergeant assignment?
Scripts: Choice "I'm ready for a shrine sergeant assignment." 1 "I have something else to ask about." 2

Lines.Text: A reminder. Check with me from time to time concerning your advancement in the Imperial cult. As you labor for the Nine, you'll rise in rank according to your efforts.

A Bosmer named Nedhelas in Caldera says his house is haunted by a ghost. You'll need an enchanted weapon or suitable spells, because only spells, enchanted weapons, or refined weapons like silver daggers can harm a ghost. I don't know what you prefer, so take these 200 drakes. Buy something that suits you, and use the rest for expenses. Talk to Nedhelas first, and report back to me if you get rid his haunted house of its ghost.

Not long ago we drove a coven of witches from the old Daedric ruins of Ashalmawia. However, one witch escaped -- a Dark Elf named Thelsa Dral. But just recently egg miners from nearby Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine have complained that the mine is cursed. Perhaps Thelsa Dral has taken refuge there. Go to Asha-Ahhe Egg Mine, near the village of khuul, and if you find the witch Thelsa Dral, kill her. When you are sure the wicked creature is dead, return and report to me. Here is some gold for expenses.

An acolyte named Linus Iulus disappeared some years ago. He was last seen leaving Suran headed east on foot for Zafirbel Bay. Recently our oracle, Lalatia Varian, has had a vision of a Silver Staff of Shaming, and Linus Iulus had one of these staves. Here is a Detect Enchantment ring and 100 gold for expenses. Go to Mount Kand. Find a Silver Staff of Shaming there, retrieve it, and bring it to me, along with any other personal effects you find that belonged to Linus Iulus.

An Argonian named Okur in Hla Oad has asked for our aid. This devout follower of the Nine is sensitive to spirits of the otherworld, and she says she is being visited by the ghost of a murder victim. The guards can't do anything in such cases. Go and speak with Okur. Here's some gold for expenses. If possible, discover the nature of the crime, and bring justice to wronged spirit so it can be laid to rest.
You were forgiven once, but you persist in your crimes against your fellow cult members. Now you are expelled, for once and for all. We have nothing more to talk about.
You've been expelled. I have nothing more to say to you. If you repent your misdeeds, you must speak to Lalatia Varian or Kaye to join the Imperial cult again.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.

You have shown yourself to be a loyal and diligent member of the Imperial cult, %PCName. As a token of our appreciation, here is a little gift that may make your labors a little easier. And please remember: check your advancement in our ranks regularly.
I'm sorry, %PCName. But we no longer have any need of your services as an almoner. Can I help you in some other way?
How good to see you again, %PCName. Continuing to serve the Imperial cult in your own inimitable fashion, I assume? I have no more tasks for you. Is there anything else I can do for you?
Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

I am very disappointed. Your talents and temperaments are apparently not suited for soliciting donations. Thank you for your efforts, but I will no longer require your services as an almoner for the Imperial cult.

Thank you, %PCName. You have exceeded our greatest expectations. I'm afraid we have no more tasks to challenge your remarkable abilities. I suspect you already outstrip your teachers. Perhaps you will consider becoming one of our lay healers or shrine sergeants, if you have not already sampled these duties. I have also passed your name to our Oracle here, Lalatia Varian. She may have tasks suited to your talents. But before you go, I have one last gift for you to remember us by. Goodbye, and good luck.
Have you spoken to Canctunian Ponius? Have you brought the generous pledge he promised to support a mission to the Ashlanders? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't get Canctunian Ponius to redeem his pledge." 2 "Yes, I have the generous pledge." 3

Lines.Text: Have you spoken to Canctunian Ponius? Have you brought the generous pledge he promised to support a mission to the Ashlanders? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't get Canctunian Ponius to redeem his pledge." 2

Lines.Text: Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

You're not trying hard enough, %PCName. We are disappointed. We all need to do our part for Imperial cult. But it's your decision. Perhaps you should take some time off and decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. When you approach us again for an almoner's mission, be sure you want to give us your full commitment.

You have succeeded where other have failed, %PCName. Congratulations. This money will greatly benefit the widows and orphans of Vvardenfell. I'm beginning to run out of gifts suitable to reward your diligence. Perhaps you may find this assortment of scrolls useful. We received them from an anonymous donor, but there may be some good in them. Now. When you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

You must take a full day to decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. Then when you are sure you want to give us your full commitment, come to me for another almoner's mission.

Canctunian Ponius of the East Empire Company has promised to sponsor a mission to the Ashlanders. Such a long-term mission will be quite expensive -- 1000 drakes is a bare minimum. We're concerned that we haven't received the money he pledged, and that he does not reply to our correspondence. We wish you to go to him in the East Empire Company Hall in Ebonheart and persuade him to provide us with the generous pledge as he promised.
Have you brought me Cunius Pelelius's 500-drake donation to the Widows and Orphans Fund? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't get Cunius Pelelius to make the donation." 2 "Yes, I have the 500-drake donation." 3

Lines.Text: Have you brought me Cunius Pelelius's 500-drake donation to the Widows and Orphans Fund? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't get Cunius Pelelius to make the donation." 2

Lines.Text: Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

You're not trying hard enough, %PCName. We are disappointed. We all need to do our part for Imperial cult. But it's your decision. Perhaps you should take some time off and decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. When you approach us again for an almoner's mission, be sure you want to give us your full commitment.

Very good, %PCName. Congratulations. This was no easy task, I'm sure. I'd like to acknowledge your faithful service with a few tokens of Zenithar's special blessing. Accept them with my thanks, and with the thanks of the Imperial cult. When you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

You must take a full day to decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. Then when you are sure you want to give us your full commitment, come to me for another almoner's mission.

Cunius Pelelius of the Caldera Mining Company is a member in good standing, and a prominent citizen, but unfortunately he has not been forthcoming with donations to help us in our good works. Please speak with him, and see if you can persuade him to donate 500 drakes to our Widows and Orphans Fund. You'll find him in Caldera at the Governor's Hall. When you've obtained the donation, deliver it to me.
Have you brought me the five bottles of Cyrodilic brandy? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to get publicans to donate enough Cyrodilic brandy." 2 "Yes, I have the Cyrodilic brandy for you." 3

Lines.Text: Have you brought me the five bottles of Cyrodilic brandy? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to get publicans to donate enough Cyrodilic brandy." 2

Lines.Text: Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

You're not trying hard enough, %PCName. We are disappointed. We all need to do our part for Imperial cult. But it's your decision. Perhaps you should take some time off and decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. When you approach us again for an almoner's mission, be sure you want to give us your full commitment.

Very good, %PCName. Congratulations. When you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again. But before you do, you might take a look at this book. I've found it helpful. Go ahead. Keep it. I've learned all I can from it.

You must take a full day to decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. Then when you are sure you want to give us your full commitment, come to me for another almoner's mission.

The Balmora shrine is planning a fundraising dinner at Fort Moonmoth. We will need food and refreshments. We've had generous offers of food, but we've had trouble getting donations of strong spirits. We've determined that we need 5 bottles of Cyrodilic brandy. Please make the rounds of the tradehouses and cornerclubs in Balmora and ask if the publicans will donate Cyrodilic brandy. When you have the brandy, please deliver it to me.
Have you brought me the red shirt and black vest? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find the shirt and vest." 2 "Yes, I have the shirt and vest for you." 3

Lines.Text: Have you brought me the red shirt and black vest? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find the shirt and vest." 2

Lines.Text: Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

You're not trying hard enough, %PCName. We are disappointed. We all need to do our part for Imperial cult. But it's your decision. Perhaps you should take some time off and decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. When you approach us again for an almoner's mission, be sure you want to give us your full commitment.
Very good, %PCName. Congratulations. And perhaps you'll find this useful in your work. When you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

Excellent! Once again, you've exceeded our expectations. Take these gifts as tokens of our gratitude for your faithful and diligent service to the Imperial cult.  And when you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

You must take a full day to decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. Then when you are sure you want to give us your full commitment, come to me for another almoner's mission.

For our coming Harvest's End pageant, we need a red shirt with a black vest. Please visit clothiers and ask if they would donate such a shirt and vest to the cult. The combination of shirt and vest is what they call a 'common shirt.' When you have the red shirt with a black vest, return and deliver them to me.
Have you reached our goal of 100 gold in donations for the Buckmoth fund? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to raise the gold." 2 "Yes, I've reached our goal." 3 "I have DOUBLED our goal!" 4

Lines.Text: Have you reached our goal of 100 gold in donations for the Buckmoth fund? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to raise the gold." 2 "Yes, I've reached our goal." 3

Lines.Text: Have you reached our goal of 100 gold in donations for the Buckmoth fund? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to raise the gold." 2

Lines.Text: Very well. Carry on, %Rank %PCName.

You're not trying hard enough, %PCName. We are disappointed. We all need to do our part for Imperial cult. But it's your decision. Perhaps you should take some time off and decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. When you approach us again for an almoner's mission, be sure you want to give us your full commitment.
Very good, %PCName. Congratulations. And perhaps you'll find this useful in your work. When you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

Excellent! Once again, you've exceeded our expectations. You are blessed with Zenithar's gift of fine words and generous sentiments. Take this, and wear it with pride. And when you're ready for your next almoner mission, speak to me again.

You must take a full day to decide whether your talents and temperaments are suited for fund raising. Then when you are sure you want to give us your full commitment, come to me for another almoner's mission.

The shrine at Buckmoth Legion Fort has experienced an unfortunate shortfall in alms for the poor, and funds are urgently needed to purchase food and blankets for orphans and indigents. Please go to Ald'ruhn and see if you can raise the money for the Buckmoth Fund. The fund needs at least 100 drakes immediately. It may be difficult to raise funds, since Ald'ruhn is a Redoran town, and most residents are Dunmer, but this money is very badly needed.
Have you reached our goal of 100 gold in donations from the Argonian mission? Or have you come to report your failure?
Scripts: Choice "No, but I'm working on it." 1 "I'm sorry, but I can't seem to raise the gold." 2 "Yes, I've reached our goal." 3 "I have DOUBLED our goal!" 4

Lines.Text: Have you reached our goal of 100 gold in donations from the Argonian mission? Or have you come to report your failure?
